(Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bringing High-Speed Internet to South Africa's Townships
summary: Access to fast, affordable internet is still out of reach for millions of South Africans, especially in townships. For nearly a quarter of the country's residents, digital infrastructure has changed little since the end of Apartheid. Startup Fibertime is seeking to bring high-speed connectivity to communities that have been left behind. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Says There Will Be a Security Agreement With EU
summary: President Donald Trump speaks on meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy, discussing peace agreement involving the European Union. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Why AI in Africa Depends on Telecom Infrastructure
summary: Axian Group's founder Hassanein Hiridjee says telecommunications is the backbone of artificial intelligence in Africa and the continent will need much stronger infrastructure to unlock its full potential. Hiridjee speaks in an interview with Bloomberg's Jennifer Zabasajja. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Novi CEO on AI Driven Shopping Trends
summary: Kimberly Shenk, CEO of Novi, says the company works with leading retailers to optimize product data for AI driven discovery. She tells Carol Massar on "Bloomberg Markets" that brands rely on Novi to help consumers find the right products more easily through AI. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The First Lady’s Terrible 2025
summary: Melania Trump’s approval rating has plummeted. But she’s still making a $40 million documentary about her life, Bloomberg Opinion columnist Nia-Malika Henderson says. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Calls for Disarming of Hamas While Meeting With Netanyahu
summary: President Donald Trump says “there has to be a disarming of Hamas” as he meets with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to discuss the ceasefire in Gaza. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Confirms US Has Struck Facility in Venezuela
summary: President Donald Trump says the US has struck a facility inside Venezuela, a significant escalation in its campaign against alleged drug trafficking operations there. He speaks while meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to discuss the ceasefire in Gaza. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Praises Zelenskiy After Talks With No Breakthrough
summary:
President Donald Trump said he made “a lot of progress” in talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy over a possible peace deal.

The tone of their news conference after the meeting was warm, although there was no breakthrough after the talks. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Says He May Bring a Lawsuit Against Fed's Powell
summary: President Donald Trump says he still wants to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, who he calls an "incompetent man," following a meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at his Mar-a-Lago resort. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Says There'll Be 'Hell to Pay' If Hamas Doesn't Disarm
summary: President Donald Trump says Hamas would be given a "very short period of time" to disarm following a meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at his Mar-a-Lago resort. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Says Iran May Be ‘Building Up Again,’ Will Strike If So: Q&A
summary: President Trump speaks to reporters ahead of a meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu about Gaza's future, Ukraine negotiations and says that he is ready to 'knock them down' if Iran begins to rebuild its nuclear program. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Says Iran Should Make a Deal
summary: "I heard Iran wants to make a deal. If they want to make a deal that's much smarter," President Donald Trump says while meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to discuss the ceasefire in Gaza. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Zelenskiy Asked Trump for 50-Year Ukraine Security Guarantee
summary:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he asked Donald Trump for US security guarantees lasting as long as half a century to help deter any future Russian invasion.
Current proposals under discussion as part of a peace plan set out a 15-year term with the possibility for an extension, though “I would like the guarantee to be much longer,” Zelenskiy said Monday in an audio message to reporters. “We would like to consider the possibility of 30, 40, 50 years and then it will be a historic decision by Trump.” Henrietta Treyz, Co-Founder at Veda Partners, breaks down the latest news out of Washington including President Trump's meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Global Markets Will Accept Tokenized Securities, Says Abra CEO Barhydt
summary: Bill Barhydt, founder and CEO of crypto exchange Abra, discusses his expectations for the crypto landscape in 2026 and says he expects markets to begin accepting tokenized securities after lawmakers vote on new crypto regulation next year. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Inside AI’s Pick-and-Shovel Boom
summary: The AI trade is shifting. Investors are chasing tech’s “pick-and-shovel” stocks — from data storage to power and construction — the companies building and fueling the next wave of AI growth. Bloomberg's Carmen Reinicke joined Bloomberg to talk about the shift. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Starfighters CEO Says Looking to Add Spaceport, Aircrafts
summary: Rick Svetkoff, founder and CEO of StarFighters, discusses his company's work to scale up low orbit satellites, including adding another spaceport and how their efforts could be used to support data centers. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Tesla Analysts Brace for a Decline in Vehicle Sales
summary: Tesla Inc. published a compilation of analyst estimates for vehicle deliveries to its website that on average shows expectations for the company to deliver 15% fewer cars in the fourth quarter from a year earlier. Craig Trudell reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: United States is 'Biggest Risk' to World Order, Says Ed Price
summary: Ed Price, NYU senior fellow, talks the stakes of geopolitics across the globe as conflicts escalate in Venezuela, Taiwan and Nigeria and breaks down what US involvement means for the global economy. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Strikes Narcotics Loading Docks in Venezuela
summary: President Donald Trump said the US struck a facility inside Venezuela, in what would be a significant escalation in its campaign against alleged drug trafficking operations there. Tyler Kendall reports on that and Trump's efforts to end the war in Ukraine. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Warner Bros. Plans to Reject Paramount Offer
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery plans to once again reject a takeover bid from Paramount Skydance after the rival media company amended the terms of its offer, according to people familiar with the company’s thinking. Lucas Shaw has more. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Margie Patel Doesn’t Expect the Stock Market to Broaden Out in 2026
summary: Margie Patel, senior portfolio manager at Allspring Global Investments, sees the US as one of the better performing sectors in the world as she offers her market outlook for 2026. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The 2025 Trades You Should Have Made
summary: Where did fictional hedge fund Hindsight Capital put its money this year? Bloomberg Opinion columnist John Authers explains the trades you should have made in 2025. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: About 40 Killed in Fire at Swiss Resort of Crans-Montana
summary: Swiss police said about 40 people were killed and 115 injured after a fire broke out in a bar in the ski resort of Crans-Montana during New Year celebrations. Police have cordoned off the area and are investigating the cause. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: AI is 'Backbone' of Venture Capital Landscape, Says Western Alliance's Bob Curley
summary: Bob Curley, deputy chief banking officer of regional banking at Western Alliance Bank, told Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec AI is the backbone of the venture capital landscape. He also said they're seeing it accelerated in energy and science. He also said the M&A Market has rebounded and brough additional sources of liquidity. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Athletic Brewing’s Big 2026 Outlook
summary: Bill Shufelt, cofounder and CEO of Athletic Brewing Company, was interviewed on January 2, 2026, discussing the rapid expansion of the nonalcoholic beer market. Shufelt highlighted that the U.S. market has grown from $100 million to over $1 billion in the past decade, with Athletic holding an 18.4% share and leading the craft segment. He attributed growth to shifting consumer preferences, especially among younger and health-conscious demographics, and noted that over 40% of consumers participate in Dry January. Shufelt outlined ongoing innovation, significant investment in manufacturing, and future plans for broader distribution, partnerships, and possibly going public. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Surveillance 1/2/2026
summary: Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern speak daily with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Canada, China Aim to Attract US H1B Holders
summary: Elizabeth Ricci, an immigration law professor, says that countries like Canada and China are spending big bucks to poach talent in the tech and AI fields, as the US clamps down on immigration and H1B visas. These moves could mean that the US sees a reduced talent pool and a downshift in competitiveness as foreign workers immigrate to other countries. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: D.E. Shaw Keeps Profits After Gains
summary: It's a rare move from a hedge fund giant. D.E. Shaw posts double-digit gains—but won’t return a dollar to investors. Bloomberg's Nishant Kumar joined Bloomberg TV and radio to discuss why the firm is breaking tradition, what it signals about markets, and what it means for clients. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Tech Stocks to Climb 20%-25% in 2026, Says Dan Ives
summary: “It’s a prove it year” for AI and tech, says Dan Ives, global head of tech research and senior equity analyst at Wedbush Securities, as he runs down the topics and companies he is focused on in 2026. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Dozens Killed in Fire at Swiss Resort of Crans-Montana
summary: Swiss police said about 40 people were killed and 115 injured after a fire broke out in a bar in the ski resort of Crans-Montana during New Year celebrations. Video shows aftermath of the incident. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Wall Street Shifts Focus to AI as Key Growth Driver
summary: By now every firm on Wall Street is well aware of the risks surrounding the artificial intelligence boom. But when it comes to the year ahead, few advocate walking away from what they describe as a “revolutionary” technology. Sam Potter has more. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: How Investors Will Be Using AI in 2026
summary: Jannick Malling, Co-Founder & Co-CEO of Public.com, joins Vonnie Quinn and Norah Mulinda to discuss how retail investors are using AI, the kind of crypto growth to expect this year on the platform, and to give his macro outlook for the year. He speaks on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Kara Swisher on AI Bubbles, Robots and Trump
summary: Kara Swisher has followed Silicon Valley for decades. Now a podcast host, she and Mishal Husain discuss AI bubbles, robots and what happens now that many tech titans have lined up behind Donald Trump. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mamdani Announces Mayor's Office of Mass Engagement
summary: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani announces the creation of the Mayor's Office of Mass Engagement at his first major press conference at Brooklyn's Grand Army Plaza. Mamdani tells reporters that the aim of the office is dedicated to "rebuilding our social infrastructure at scale" and ensure that city government listens to New Yorkers "consistently and with real consequence." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mamdani Rides Train to Work a Day After His Inauguration
summary: Zohran Mamdani greets commuters on his way into work a day after being sworn-in as New York City's 112th mayor. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Athletic Brewing’s Big 2026 Outlook
summary: From Dry January to year-round moderation—non-alcoholic beer is booming. Bill Shufelt, the Co-Founder and CEO of Athletic Brewing joined Bloomberg TV and radio to talk about the outlook for NA beer in the new year and how his brand is trying to redefine how we drink. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The Gurus Promising to Fix India’s Small Businesses
summary:
Across India, gurus are promising to fix small businesses, often at MBA-level prices.

These expensive coaching courses mix management advice, mindset training and even family mediation in a largely unregulated market. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: What Travel Looks Like in 2026
summary: Travel in 2026 is expected to change fast. Dakota Smith, President and Co-Founder of Hopper, joined Bloomberg TV and radio to explain the trends shaping travel—from flexibility and disruption protection to AI-driven service. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: 'I Will Govern as a Democratic Socialist' Mamdani’s Full NYC Inauguration Speech
summary: Zohran Mamdani unapologetically promised to lead New York City as a democratic socialist during a frigid inauguration ceremony on the steps of City Hall, a warning to those who believed he might moderate his positions after taking office. The nearly two-hour long event Thursday featured speeches by two of the US’s most liberal members of Congress, Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Senator Bernie Sanders. New York Attorney General Letitia James, a frequent target of President Donald Trump, also had a speaking role. The ceremony served as a not-so-subtle statement of resistance to White House policies from the nation’s largest city. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: BYD Topples Tesla as EV King
summary: BYD is now the world’s top seller of electric cars, overtaking Tesla after a decade of dominance by Elon Musk’s company. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow breaks down how the world's richest man came in second. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Maduro Captured, Indicted After US Airstrikes on Venezuela
summary: President Nicolás Maduro has been charged in the US after he was captured and flown out of Venezuela. Bloomberg's Derek Wallbank explains. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Maduro In US Custody: What's Next for Venezuela?
summary: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his wife are in US custody and are being taken back to New York to face a series of criminal charges. Bloomberg New Economy Editorial Director Erik Schatzker spoke to Maduro in 2021. He talks about what comes next for the regime.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Maduro Stole the Election in Venezuela, Says Author
summary: Mariana Atencio, Venezuelan author and American journalist, reacts to the US airstrikes on Venezuela. She says President Nicolás Maduro stole the election there and is essentially a dictator. She speaks on "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Markets Not Worried About Venezuela, McNally Says
summary: Bob McNally, Rapidan Energy Group founder and president, says the oil markets won't be too worried about a loss in supply from Venezuela in the aftermath of US strikes. He speaks on "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Did Trump Just Define His Legacy?
summary: President Trump’s global legacy now rests heavily on what happens next in Venezuela, Bloomberg Opinion columnist Andreas Kluth explains. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Calls Operation to Capture Venezuela's Maduro Dark and Deadly
summary: President Donald Trump talks about the operation to capture Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro in Caracas. Trump says that all Venezuelan military capacities were powerless. “It was dark and it was deadly,” Trump says. Trump spoke Saturday morning from Mar-a-Lago in Florida. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump’s Plan for Venezuela’s Oil Industry
summary: Having attacked Venezuela and deposed its president, Nicolas Maduro, US President Donald Trump now says he has big plans for the country’s oil industry and its vast reserves.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Says US Hit Venezuela With 'Large Scale Strike'
summary: Donald Trump said the US carried out "a large scale strike" against Venezuela and captured President Nicolas Maduro, an extraordinary escalation in Trump's months-long campaign against the country. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Strikes Venezuela Without Congressional Approval
summary: President Donald Trump launches airstrikes against Venezuela without approval from Congress. President Nicolás Maduro has been charged in the US after he was captured and flown out of Venezuela. Lester Munson of the BGR Group and Bloomberg Contributor Jeanne Sheehan Zaino discuss on a special “Balance of Power.”

title: Trump Says US Companies Will Rebuild Venezuelan Oil Infrastructure
summary: President Donald Trump said American oil companies will “spend billions of dollars” to fix oil infrastructure in Venezuela following the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by US forces in an early morning raid Saturday. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Says US ‘Going to Run’ Venezuela Until Transition Possible
summary: President Donald Trump said the US is “going to run the country until such time as we can do a safe, proper and judicious transition.” Trump spoke Saturday after US forces captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife in an early morning raid. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Strikes Venezuela, Maduro Captured and Indicted
summary:
The US launches airstrikes against Venezuela and captures President Nicolás Maduro and his wife. They have both been flown back to the US. “The United States of America has successfully carried out a large scale strike against Venezuela and its leader, President Nicolas Maduro, who has been, along with his wife, captured and flown out of the Country,” President Donald Trump wrote on social media Saturday. 
US Attorney General Pam Bondi said on X Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, have been indicted, with the Venezuelan leader facing charges of “Narco-Terrorism Conspiracy, Cocaine Importation Conspiracy, Possession of Machineguns and Destructive Devices, and Conspiracy to Possess Machineguns and Destructive Devices against the United States.”
Bloomberg's Nathan Hager reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Venezuelan Interior Minister Speaks After Airstrikes
summary: Interior Minister Diosdado Cabello speaks in Caracas following a series of US airstrikes on Venezuela that mark an escalation in President Donald Trump's administration’s months-long campaign against the nation. President Nicolás Maduro has been charged in the US after he was captured and flown out of the country.(Translated from Spanish by Associated Press) (Source: VTV via Associated Press)

title: Video Shows Explosions in Venezuela
summary: Video shows overnight explosions in Venezuela as the Latin American nation accused the US of launching an attack on the country. The first blasts were heard around 2 a.m. local time, according to residents. The Venezuelan government said military and civilian targets had been hit across three regions. (Source: Validated User Generated Content and AP)

title: What the US Strike on Venezuela Means for Oil
summary: President Donald Trump says the US will be strongly involved in Venezuela’s oil industry after US forces captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife in an early morning raid Saturday. Venezuela’s oil infrastructure was not affected by US military airstrikes in Caracas and other states, according to sources with knowledge of the matter. Blomberg’s Julian Lee examines how the action impacts the Venezuelan oil industry and global oil market. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Maduro Taken Into Detention Center in New York
summary: Ousted Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro arrives at a detention center in New York after he was taken into custody in a US military operation. (Source: RAPIDRESPONSE47 via X)

title: Venezuela's Rodriguez Defends Socialism in 2021 Interview
summary: Venezuela Vice President Delcy Rodriguez said the economic reforms implemented by President Nicolás Maduro were consistent with the administration's guiding principles of Bolivarian socialism. She spoke exclusively in Caracas with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker in June 2021. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: AI Buildout Bottlenecks for 2026
summary: Ryan Mallory, CEO of Flexential, one of the largest privately held data center operator in the US, discusses the sticking points in the AI buildout as questions grow around power and infrastructure constraints. He joins Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Atlantic Council's Gray on US 'Core Interests'
summary: Atlantic Council Non-resident Senior Fellow Alexander Gray analyzes how the Trump administration aims to defend what it perceives as America's vital "core interests." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Tech Traders Shrug Off Maduro Ouster | Bloomberg Tech 1/5/2026
summary: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses the AI trade as tech investors show optimism at the start of 2026. Plus Tesla's China factory shipments rise in December but still drop in 2025. And we preview CES as it kicks off in Las Vegas with the CEOs of Nvidia and AMD set to speak.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Caracas Residents on Edge After Maduro Arrest
summary: Venezuela is on edge even after the removal of Nicolás Maduro and the swearing in of Delcy Rodríguez as acting president. Military intelligence patrols and armed gangs are out on the streets of Caracas. Bloomberg's Crayton Harrison reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China 'Deeply Shocked' by US Maduro Move
summary: President Donald Trump’s capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro has been condemned by Venezuela's allies, including China. Meanwhile, users on Chinese social media are saying the operation could be a template for handling tensions with Taiwan. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Columbia's Tim Wu on Monopoly Concerns ‘Outside Tech'
summary: Tim Wu, Columbia Law professor and former White House technology adviser, says policymakers need to ensure big tech does not extract too much from the economy. He tells Romaine Bostick and Katie Greifeld on “The Close” that it may be time to push back on big tech’s power. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Investors Hunting for Something New in AI: Anna Rathbun
summary: Investors are looking for something new from Nvidia and other AI companies in 2026, says Anna Rathbun, CEO of Grenadilla Advisory. She discusses what markets are watching for and where there is still room to run with Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Kodiak AI CEO on Driverless Truck Partnership With Bosch
summary: Don Burnette, Kodiak Founder and CEO, says the company is now in production with driverless systems operating safely. He tells Romaine Bostick and Katie Greifeld on “The Close” that adoption is expected to accelerate as customers grow more comfortable with autonomous trucking. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Maduro Captured: What This Means for China and Taiwan
summary: China has slammed what it called Washington's "hegemonic acts" after strikes on Venezuela and the capture of Nicolas Maduro. Zhou Bo, a retired People's Liberation Army senior colonel, says the US operation essentially allows China to position itself as a stabilizing force upholding the international order. He also explores the implications of the Trump administration’s actions in Venezuela for Beijing's Taiwan strategy. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Maduro Tells US Federal Court 'I Am Innocent'
summary: Nicolás Maduro pleaded not guilty to US charges in a narco-terrorism case against him, saying "I am innocent" and "I am not guilty" through an interpreter. Maduro's wife also pleaded not guilty. They're both being held without bail. Bloomberg's Myles Miller reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Nvidia CEO Huang Announces New AI Tools for Autonomous Vehicles
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announces a group of AI models and tools designed to speed the development of autonomous vehicles during his presentation at the CES trade show in Las Vegas. The free offering is aimed at creating vehicles that can think their way out of unexpected situations, such as a traffic-light outage. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Nvidia CEO Huang Says New Vera Rubin Design Is in Full Production
summary: "The race is on for AI," Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says during his presentation at the CES trade show in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Rep. Goodlander on Maduro Ouster, ACA Funding
summary: Maggie Goodlander, Democratic Representative of New Hampshire, talks about the US ousting Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, saying President Donald Trump is 'unserious' about tackling drug traffickers. She also discusses the likelihood of Congress avoiding another government shutdown by the end of the month. She joins Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall on 'Bloomberg: Balance of Power.' (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Gold, Silver and European Defense Stocks Up on Venezuela Risk | The Opening Trade 1/5/2026
summary:
European defense stocks rise following the US military strikes on Venezuela and its capture of President Nicolás Maduro. Gold and silver also advance, with investors weighing heightened geopolitical risks. Meanwhile, oil markets shrug off the possibility of short-term disruptions, believing any drop in Venezuelan output could be offset by increases elsewhere.

The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Tom Mackenzie. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The Outlook for AI Regulation in 2026
summary: The prospect of a fragmented regulatory landscape is hanging over the AI market. Jessica Melugin, director of the Center for Technology and Innovation with the Competitive Enterprise Institute, discusses the outlook for federal rules. She joins Caroline Hyde on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Brigadier General Kimmitt on Venezuela
summary: Mark Kimmitt, Retired US Army Brigadier General and Former Assistant US Secretary of State for Political-Military Affairs, discusses the latest developments on Venezuela. He speaks with Avril Hong and Paul Allen on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade".  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Venezuela Oil Too Heavy to be Desired, Analyst Says
summary: Mukesh Sahdev, Founder CEO & Chief Oil Analyst at energy markets consultancy XAnalysts, says there's been a lot of "hot talk and wrong analysis" on the significance of Venezuela's oil reserves. He says chemistry matters more in analyzing the oil market impact of the nation's political uncertainty. He also explains China's role in stabilizing oil markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: What's Next for Oil Market After US Captures Maduro?
summary: Jorge León, a former OPEC official and now Rystad Energy's Senior Vice President and Head of Geopolitical Analysis, talks about possible supply disruptions, the lack of American oil majors' response so far and Venezuelan crude's role in world trade. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: 'Sentiment is Back' in Chinese Onshore Equities: Hong
summary: Lotus Asset Management CIO Hao Hong discusses the surge in China's A-shares, warning that economic fundamentals have not yet caught up with the rally. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: AMD's Su Unveils New Tech, Talks Up AI Demand
summary: Analyst on AMD's New Tech, AI Demand DEK: Advanced Micro Devices CEO Lisa Su touted the attributes of a future generation of products, saying the pace of AI innovation has been incredible. Constellation Research founder Ray Wang provides context. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: World Braces for Impact Following US Ouster of Maduro | Balance of Power: 1/5/2026
summary: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Mike Lawler, Republican Representative of New York, talks about President Trump's legal justifications for his actions against Venezuela and the ouster of President Nicolas Maduro, and Maggie Goodlander, Democratic Representative of New Hampshire, discusses the Maduro ouster and says the Trump administration has a lot of questions to answer about what comes next for Venezuela. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bisat: Lebanon's Gap Law Fair Process to Repay Depositors
summary: Lebanon's cabinet has approved draft legislation aimed at freeing up bank deposits that have been trapped in its banking system for years. The proposed law would allow some depositors to recover part of their savings, with larger balances converted into bonds backed by central bank assets. The move is seen as a key step towards untangling the financial crisis facing the Middle East's most-indebted nation. Amer Bisat, Lebanon's Economy and Trade Minister spoke exclusively to Bloomberg’s Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche about Lebanon’s economic recovery. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Qualcomm CEO Says AI 'Not a Bubble' | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 01/06/2026
summary:
On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss the Supreme Court setting Friday for opinions, with a possible decision about President Trump's tariff regime on deck given the court's expedited handling of the case. Bloomberg's Greg Stohr joins the show to discuss. Plus, Bloomberg International Economics & Policy Correspondent Michael McKee looks ahead to Friday's December Payrolls report. Also, Bloomberg Tech Co-Host Caroline Hyde sits down with Qualcomm President & CEO Cristiano Amon from CES in Las Vegas about the future of robotics and AI. Mandeep Singh of Bloomberg Intelligence also weighs in on 
Nvidia and Siemens' AI industrial partnership, and Christina Lee of Oaktree Capital Management 
discusses enthusiasm in private equity and M&A. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Markets Process Geopolitical Risks, CES Kicks Off in Las Vegas | Bloomberg Markets 1/6/2026
summary: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests: Citi Global Head of Commodities Research Max Layton and General Catalyst CEO Hemant Taneja. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Tech at CES | Bloomberg Tech 1/6/2026
summary: Bloomberg Tech's Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow are live from CES in Las Vegas. They sit down with AMD CEO Lisa Su after the company announced a new chip for corporate data center use. Plus, Lucid Interim CEO Marc Winterhoff weighs in on the global EV and robotaxi landscape. And the CEO of gaming-hardware company Razer joins to discuss its latest AI gaming ecosystem. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Denmark Says a US Attack on Greenland Would Break NATO
summary: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said that if US President Donald Trump were to attack Greenland, it would mean the end of the NATO alliance. Trump has long argued that the US must control Greenland to ensure its own security. Officials in Copenhagen have been alarmed by the US president’s insistence on taking control of the Danish island for security reasons following the raid on Caracas during which US forces arrested Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro. Bloomberg’s Sanne Wass reports.

title: European, US Officials Set for Ukraine Talks in Paris
summary: European leaders and US officials aim to finalize an agreement on security guarantees that include the possibility of American boots on the ground in postwar Ukraine in a bid to ensure that any peace deal endures. French President Emmanuel Macron will host the Paris meeting. The US will be represented by President Donald Trump’s envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, according to people familiar with the matter. Bloomberg’s Greg Sullivan reports.

title: Greenland on Alert After US Venezuela Move
summary: Rufus Gifford, former US Ambassador to Denmark, shares his thoughts on how Europe is reacting to President Trump's renewed calls to take over Greenland following the US Venezuela move this past weekend. Gifford states trust has been broken between Denmark & the United States, and that it is heartbreaking to hear the rhetoric from the President and his administration. He speaks with Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power."  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Lebanon’s Economy & Trade Minister; Nvidia’s Rubin Chips | Horizons Middle East and Africa 1/6/2026
summary: Delcy Rodríguez has been sworn in as acting president of Venezuela, as Nicolas Maduro and his wife plead not guilty in the US to drug violence and weapons charges. Also on the show: Nvidia CEO, Jensen Huang, says the company's highly-anticipated Rubin data center chips are nearing release; Ethiopia says it has reached an agreement in principle with bondholders on a restructuring; we speak exclusively to Amer Bisat, Lebanon's Economy and Trade Minister as the cabinet passes its long-awaited banking law draft. Guests include: Gaurav Kashyap, Equiti Group, Futures & Equities Lead; Amer Bisat, Lebanon's Economy and Trade Minister. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Legal AI Platform Legora Expands Into Australia
summary:
As investors pile into the AI boom, Australia is attracting massive bets from global tech firms. 
Legora, a Swedish AI startup, aims to tackle legal grunt work by automating tasks such as contract review and due diligence. Heather Paterson, the company's lead for Asia Pacific and Japan, discusses the expansion into the Australian market and the adoption of AI for legal tasks on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade".  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Nvidia CEO says Rubin in Production, Keynote Falls Flat
summary:
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says their highly anticipated new Vera Rubin systems are nearing release this year. Speaking at CES in Las Vegas, Huang said customers will soon be able to try out the technology, helping speed AI development. Nvidia share's didn't react much to the presentation. Bloomberg Technology anchor Ed Ludlow breaks down Huang's keynote on 'Bloomberg: The Asia Trade.'

 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Nvidia’s Rubin Chips on Track, CEO Huang Says
summary: Nvidia Corp.’s highly anticipated Rubin data center processors are in production and customers will soon be able to try out the technology, according to Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang. Meanwhile, Advanced Micro Devices Inc. announced a new chip for corporate data center use and talked up the attributes of a future generation of products for that market. Bloomberg Intelligence’s Masahiro Wakasugi breaks down the situation.

title: Will OpenAI or Anthropic IPO in 2026?
summary: Forget tech unicorns. It’s now the era of the “hectocorn,” Bloomberg Opinion columnist Dave Lee explains. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Pictet Co-CEO Sagayam on Global Investment Opportunities
summary: Pictet Group Managing Partner and Co-CEO Raymond Sagayam shares his views on investment opportunities in a rapidly changing global landscape. He speaks on Insight With Haslinda Amin. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Razer Plans $600 Million Push to Capture AI Gaming Demand
summary: Razer, the gaming peripherals company, unveiled a series of new products powered by artificial intelligence as it aims for a far-reaching revamp around AI. Dana Wollman is at CES in Las Vegas and got a sneak peak at what's in the pipeline (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Rep. Donalds on Possible Next Steps for Venezuela
summary: Rep. Byron Donalds (R-FL) states President Trump has been following the law when discussing this year's midterm elections and the topic of impeachment. Donalds also talks about if what happened in Venezuela will occur in other Central American countries and what the next steps are for Venezuela following the capture of President Maduro and his wife. Representative Donalds speaks with Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The Asia Trade 01/06/26
summary: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Sydney and Singapore with Paul Allen and Avril Hong, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Strong Start to 2026 for Chinese Stocks | The China Show 1/6/2026
summary: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, David Ingles and Yvonne Man give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Stocks Flirt with Record, Bull Run Extends | The Close 1/6/2026
summary: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Kayne Anderson Rudnick’s Julie Biel, Council on Foreign Relations’ Richard Haass, Baird’s David George, Hines’ David Steinbach, Wells Fargo Investment Institute’s Veronica Willis, 15-Time NBA all-Star Shaquille O’Neal, Hershey’s Kirk Tanner, Bernstein Research’s Stacy Rasgon, Duke University’s Patrick Duddy, Former New York City Fed President Bill Dudley. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Three Possible Paths for Venezuela After Maduro's Ouster
summary: US strikes, the capture of President Nicolas Maduro and the US intention to run the country — at least temporarily — mean Venezuela has a shot at restoring democracy and prosperity. Neither outcome is guaranteed. US President Donald Trump’s Jan. 3 news conference and remarks from Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Jan. 4 left many questions unanswered. Jimena Zuniga serves as Latin America Geoeconomics Analyst and Argentina Economist at Bloomberg Economics. She discusses what might happen next in the embattled South American nation with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: President is Legally Justified in Military Strikes: Rep. Lawler
summary: Mike Lawler, Republican Representative of New York, joins Tyler Kendall and Joe Mathieu on 'Bloomberg: Balance of Power' to discuss the US ouster of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, saying President Donald Trump was legally justified with the military strike, and that he does not blame the administration for withholding information from Congress prior to the operation. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: AI Performance Relying More on Power Flow: Infineon CEO
summary: CEO Jochen Hanebeck discusses how AI has become a growth story for Infineon. He joins Annabelle Droulers on “Bloomberg Markets” from CES in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Warns He'll Be Impeached if GOP Loses Midterms | Balance of Power: Late Edition 01/06/2026
summary: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Rep. Chris Deluzio (D-PA) talks about President Trump warning he'll be impeached if the GOP loses the midterm elections. Rufus Gifford, former US Ambassador to Denmark, shares Greenland's & Denmark's reaction to Trump's renewed calls to take over Greenland. Rep. Byron Donalds (R-FL) on next steps for Venezuela. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Ben Carson on Trump's New Housing Plan, New Food Pyramid
summary: Ben Carson, White House Nutrition Advisor and former US Secretary of Housing & Urban Development, discusses President Trump's decision to take steps to ban institutional investors from buying single family homes. Carson talks about if this decision will bring down the cost of housing and if Trump is targeting big business. He also shares his thoughts on the new food pyramid that flips upside down to promote protein. Ben Carson speaks with Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Tech at CES | Bloomberg Tech 1/7/2026
summary: Bloomberg Tech's Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow are live from CES in Las Vegas. They sit down with Jim Johnson of Intel's Client Computing Group to discuss the chipmaker's efforts to make its products competitive again. They also discuss why Warner Brothers rejected an amended takeover offer from Paramount Skydance; and they are joined by Mobileye CEO Amnon Shashua to weigh in on the company's acquisition of Israeli startup Mentee Robotics. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Tech: Asia CES Special 1/7/26
summary: Bloomberg's Shery Ahn and Annabelle Droulers host a special edition of 'Bloomberg Tech: Asia' at CES 2026 in Las Vegas, featuring one of China's rising stars, Deep Robotics. Plus, an exclusive interview with Samsung on their latest AI developments and outlook for the year ahead. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China's Hesai to Supply Lidar Sensors to Nvidia
summary: Nvidia has picked Chinese lidar maker Hesai as its laser technology partner. Its co-founder and CEO David Li says the partnership is good news for global OEMs as the platform will streamline software, hardware and data in its autonomous driving product. He spoke with Bloomberg's Annabelle Droulers from the sidelines of CES in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Greenland Force Not Ruled Out, Venezuela To Send US Oil | Daybreak Europe 1/7/2026
summary:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, the White House says Donald Trump will not rule out using military force to take control of Greenland, standing firm that acquiring the island is a national security priority. 

Brent fell after Donald Trump said Venezuela will send up to 50 million barrels of oil to the US. That’s worth roughly $2.8 billion at the current market prices and represents about 50 days of Venezuelan oil production.

Today's guests: University of Essex Government Professor, Natasha Lindstaedt & Aneeka Gupta, Director of Macroeconomics Research at WisdomTree. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Discord Is Said to File Confidentially for IPO
summary: Discord Inc. filed confidentially for an initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter. The chat app company is working with Goldman Sachs Group and JPMorgan Chase on a listing, people familiar with the plans said. Bailey Lipschultz has more on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Europas Raumfahrt
summary: Europas Raumfahrtindustrie versucht den Vorsprung von Elon Musks SpaceX aufzuholen. Hoffnungsträger sind einige europäische Neulinge — im Fokus steht ein Münchner Startup. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Futurum's Newman on CES and AI Tech Trends
summary: Daniel Newman, CEO of Futurum Group, shares his thoughts on AI valuations, agentic AI, and the biggest trends he sees emerging from CES in Las Vegas. He spoke on Bloomberg’s Insight with Haslinda Amin. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: IDC's Ma: 2026 May Be A Down Year For PC Market
summary: IDC Devices Research VP Bryan Ma believes 2026 may be a down year for the PC market, as memory shortage (production gets diverted to AI datacenters) is driving prices upwards instead. He speaks with Haslinda Amin on "Insight with Haslinda Amin." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: AI Boom Sparks Global Chip Shortage and Price Surge | Insight with Haslinda Amin 01/07/2026
summary: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Intel’s Comeback Bid Centers on New Processor Design
summary: Intel unveiled a new mobile computer processor design, part of a bid to make its products competitive again. Jim Johnson, Senior Vice President of Intel's Client Computing Group, discusses what the new design will do for performance and how it fits in with the company’s strategy. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech” from CES in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Lenovo CTO on AI Product Rollout, Vision
summary: Lenovo is unveiling its new AI products and partnerships at its annual Tech World conference, which this year coincides with CES in Las Vegas. CTO Tolga Kurtoğlu says the company is focusing on providing on-device Hybrid AI technology for its customers and sees embedding artificial intelligence into robotics as the future of its adoption. He spoke with Annabelle Droulers in the sidelines of CES. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Mobileye CEO on $900 Million Robot Startup Purchase
summary: Mobileye, the maker of self-driving car technology, is buying startup Mentee Robotics for $900 million. Mobileye CEO Amnon Shashua explains how the acquisition fits in with the company’s push to develop humanoid robots. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech” from CES in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Samsung Warns of Price Hikes as Memory Costs Rise
summary: Samsung’s new products at CES have generated fresh buzz, but President Wonjin Lee sounded the alarm: memory‑chip shortages could drive price hikes across the electronics industry. Lee exclusively spoke with Bloomberg’s Shery Ahn on the sidelines of CES in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Saudi Arabia Moves to Open Property Market
summary: Saudi Arabia is moving to open its real estate market to foreign buyers, a shift designed to unlock new capital and support a construction boom as the kingdom looks to diversify its economy. Bloomberg's Zainab Fattah told Joumanna Bercetche on Horizons Middle East and Africa that the change could draw international investors into housing projects worth hundreds of billions of riyals. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Saudi Arabia Opens Stocks to All Foreign Investors
summary: Saudi Arabia is opening its stock market to all foreign investors, in the kingdom's latest effort to boost flows and revive a market which has lagged emerging peers. Bloomberg's Christine Burke joined Horizons Middle East and Africa to explain. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: TDK CEO Sees Opportunity in Smart Glasses
summary: Apple battery supplier TDK is moving into smart glasses, putting it in direct competition with Chinese rivals in the race to produce the lightest wearables. CEO Noboru Saito discusses opportunity in the realm of smart glasses with Bloomberg's Asia Trade anchor Shery Ahn at the CES event in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China’s Feud With Japan Worsens | The China Show 1/7/2026
summary: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, David Ingles and Yvonne Man give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump: Venezuela to Send Oil Worth Up to $2.8 Bln to US
summary: President Donald Trump said Venezuela would relinquish as much as 50 million barrels of oil to the US, worth roughly $2.8 billion at the current market price. The volumes cited by Trump would represent about 30 to 50 days of Venezuelan oil production before the US’s partial blockade of the country. The announcement comes as a blow to China, previously the top buyer of Venezuela’s oil and a close partner. Bloomberg’s Stephen Stapczynski reports.

title: US, Europe Make Progress on Ukraine Security Protocols
summary: President Donald Trump’s administration and Ukraine’s European allies converged toward an agreement to offer security guarantees long sought by Kyiv during a meeting in Paris. US special envoy Steve Witkoff said officials made significant progress on a plan to end Russia’s war and “largely finished the security protocols.” He vowed that the US-backed protocols would “deter” and “defend” Ukraine from future attacks. Bloomberg’s Greg Sullivan reports.

title: US Won’t Rule Out Use of Military to Acquire Greenland
summary: The White House said President Donald Trump won’t rule out the use of military force to acquire Greenland. Secretary of State Marco Rubio downplayed the notion of military action on Monday, signaling that an invasion was not imminent and that the goal was to buy the island from Denmark, according to the Wall Street Journal. Bloomberg’s Rosalind Mathieson reports.

title: Warner Bros. Rejects Latest Paramount Bid
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery rejected an amended takeover offer from Paramount Skydance and encouraged shareholders to stick with a deal it has in place with Netflix. Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the news with Quickplay Chief Business Officer Paul Pastor, who previously held senior executive positions at Discovery Communications and the Walt Disney Company. They speak on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Ziemba: ‘Drill, Baby, Drill’ Everywhere Except the US
summary: Global markets remained resilient as investors grow accustomed to President Trump's unorthodox military operations, viewing them as temporary shocks rather than long-term risks. Instead of panicking over the Venezuela incursion, traders are focusing on AI growth, potential rate cuts, and a stabilized oil supply. Rachel Ziemba, founder of Ziemba Insights spoke to Bloomberg’s Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche on the new world order created by President Trump. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: AI Policy Remains an Open Question at CES
summary: As AI announcements continue to roll out of CES, questions about US export controls and Chinese demand hang over the sector. Undersecretary of State for Economic Affairs Jacob Helberg, founder of the Hill and Valley Forum, discusses AI policy with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech” from CES in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump's New Plan to Address Housing Affordability | Balance of Power: Late Edition 01/07/2026
summary: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Senator Jeanne Shaheen (D-NH) and Ivo Daalder, former US Ambassador to NATO, react to the Trump administration's idea to acquire Greenland. Ben Carson, White House Nutrition Advisor and former US Secretary of Housing & Urban Development, discusses President Trump's decision to take steps to ban institutional investors from buying single family homes. Rep. Nicole Malliotakis (R-NY) on what she expects to happen when the House votes on the ACA subsidies. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Tech at CES | Bloomberg Tech 1/8/2026
summary: Bloomberg Tech's Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow are live from CES in Las Vegas. They break down China's plans to approve some imports of Nvidia's H200 chips as soon as this quarter, and Anthropic's new round of funding that would value the company at $350 billion. Plus, live conversations from CES with the CEO of Xreal, US State Undersecretary for Economic Affairs Jacob Helberg and more. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ETM's Mamadou On Greenland’s Mineral Potential
summary: Energy Transition Minerals MD Daniel Mamadou says greater Western interest in Greenland’s strategic and mineral potential is welcome. His company is an Australian miner with a rare earths project in Greenland. Daniel speaks with Haslinda Amin on "Insight with Haslinda Amin." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Future of Robots on Display at CES
summary: Humanoid robots have been folding laundry, lifting boxes and demonstrating new AI-powered capabilities at CES but their future in homes is likely still far away. Jan Liphardt, founder and CEO of OpenMind and professor of bioengineering at Stanford University, discusses the outlook for AI robots with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech” from CES in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Hitachi SVP on Business Strategy, Role of AI
summary: Shashank Samant, Senior Vice President and Executive Chairman at Hitachi, discusses the company's business strategy and the role of AI as a growth driver. He speaks with Shery Ahn on "The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ICE Agent Fatally Shoots Woman in Minneapolis
summary:
An ICE agent fatally shot a woman during a confrontation in Minneapolis, fueling backlash over the agency’s presence in the city amid the Trump administration’s migrant crackdown.

 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Kindred Ventures Founder on Investing Trends From CES
summary: Steve Jang, managing partner and founder of Kindred Ventures, joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech” from CES in Las Vegas to discuss what trends he’s seeing at the consumer tech conference and how they are shaping his investment strategy. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ChatGPT Has a Traffic Problem
summary: It’s time for Sam Altman to start worrying, Bloomberg Opinion columnist Dave Lee says. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Paramount Reaffirms Warner Bros. Offer, Views Cable Channels as Worth Nothing
summary: Paramount Skydance Corp. reaffirmed its offer to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. for $30 a share in cash, insisting its hostile bid is superior to one from Netflix Inc. after multiple rejections. Michelle Davis reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Robots Take the Spotlight at CES 2026 in Las Vegas
summary: Robots, AI and wearable tech are just a few things spotted at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. Samantha Kelly shines the spotlight on all the gadgets that premiered  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US to Control Venezuelan Oil, Samsung Profit Triples | The Asia Trade 1/8/2026
summary: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Sydney and Singapore with Paul Allen and Avril Hong, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. title: Oil Edges Lower as Trump Moves to Ban Investors From Buying Homes | The Close 1/7/2026
summary: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Meredith Whitney Advisory Group's Meredith Whitney, RiverFront Investment Group's Kevin Nicholson, Atlantic Council's Joseph Webster, Union Square Advisors' Ted Smith, Raymond James' Larry Adam, Amherst's Sean Dobson, Southern Bancorp’s Darrin Williams, Anduril’s Palmer Luckey, Bain & Co’s Suzanne Kumar, FDA Commissioner Dr. Marty Makary. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Tuya Smart COO on Business Strategy, AI, IOT
summary: Alex Yang, Co-founder, COO and CFO at Tuya Smart, discusses the company's business strategy and the integration of AI and IoT technologies. He speaks with Annabelle Droulers on "The Asia Trade".  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Strategy on Venezuelan Oil Takes Shape
summary: US President Donald Trump’s administration said it would take control of as much as 50 million barrels of Venezuelan oil. The strategy thrusts the federal government into direct involvement in the international oil market and promises to reinvigorate flows of Venezuelan crude to American refineries after years of sanctions. Bloomberg’s Rosalind Mathieson reports.

title: Xreal CEO on Revamping Basic AR Glasses
summary: Chi Xu, CEO and co-founder of Xreal, unveiled an upgraded entry-level AR glasses product at CES. He explains how the 1S model improves on the previous Xreal One glasses by increasing the video resolution at a lower price point. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech” from CES in Las Vegas. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Chinese 'AI Tiger' Z.ai Jumps in Hong Kong Debut
summary: Shares of Z.ai, the first of China's so-called "AI Tigers" to go public, rose in their Hong Kong debut after a $558-million initial public offering. The generative-AI startup, better known as Zhipu and trading under the name Knowledge Atlas Technology, plans to use a bulk of the IPO proceeds for research and development. Its co-founder and chairman Liu Debing spoke exclusively to Bloomberg. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: AI Build-Out Forces Analysts to Cover Entire Supply Chain
summary: Meta agreed to a series of electricity deals for AI data centers that will make it the biggest buyer of nuclear power among its hyperscaler peers. Paul Meeks, managing director and head of technology research at Freedom Capital Markets, discusses how energy needs and the AI build-out are changing what tech analysts examine. He joins Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Aldi expandiert
summary: In Europa hat Aldi Schwierigkeiten, mit Rivalen wie Lidl mitzuhalten. Der Discounter wettet stattdessen auf die USA und expandiert dort kräftig. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: House Passes Bill to Extend ACA Tax Credits | Balance of Power: Late Edition 01/08/2026
summary: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Rep. Nick LaLota (R-NY) & Rep. Ryan Mackenzie (R-PA) discuss why they voted yes on the House vote to pass the Obamacare extensions. Rep. Greg Stanton (D-AZ) and Rep. Madeleine Dean (D-PA) share their expectations on the Senate's next steps following the vote. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Barnes & Noble CEO James Daunt on the Bookstore Renaissance
summary: Barnes & Noble is the largest retail bookseller in the United States. The company has approximately 600 bookstores across the United States, as well as its online bookstore at BN.com, the NOOK Digital business, which offers both eBooks and an audio book subscriptions service, the SparkNotes educational service, and stationery and gift retailer Paper Source. James Daunt serves as the CEO of Barnes & Noble. He discusses his stewardship and rejuvenation of the popular chain, as well as whether the Elliott Advisors-owned company might once again go public. James speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on Bloomberg Businessweek Daily. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Supreme Court Delays Trump Tariff Ruling | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 01/09/2026
summary: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec discuss the latest on the Supreme Court. They also discuss today's economic data with Gregory Daco, Chief Economist at EY. They also discusses President Donald Trump proposed ban on institutional residential real estate purchases and push to make Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac buy $200 billion in mortgage bonds with Katie Hubbard, President of US Capital Markets at Walton Global. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Markets 1/9/2026
summary: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. Today's guests: Vanessa Neumann, a former Venezuelan opposition representative to the UK and founder of advisory firm Asymmetrica, Jennifer Hillmant, Former Vice Chair of the US Internal Trade Commission and a former Member of the World Trade Organization Appellate Body (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Meta to Become the Biggest Nuclear Buyer Among Hyperscalers | Bloomberg Tech 1/9/2026
summary: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow discusses Meta’s latest energy deals for AI data centers that will make it the biggest buyer of nuclear power among its hyperscaler peers. Plus, MiniMax, one of China’s largest generative AI startups, goes public in Hong Kong. And, Snowflake CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy talks about the company’s plan to buy AI-powered observability platform Observe. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Did Competitive Geopolitical Factors Influence US Venezuela Move?
summary: Rebecca Bill Chavez, Inter-American Dialogue President & CEO, discusses the possible competitive geopolitical factors that may have influenced the Trump administration's moves last weekend in Venezuela. She also talks about her concerns about the US possibly ruling Venezuela from afar, the security risks around the country, and how allies are watching what the administration does next. Rebecca speaks with Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Chinese AI Firm MiniMax Soars in Hong Kong Trading Debut
summary:
MiniMax, one of China's largest generative AI startups, surged in its trading debut in Hong Kong after raising $619 million in its initial public offering. Co-founder and COO Yeyi Yun says the company plans to use the proceeds for R&D for foundation models. She also discusses overseas expansion plans on Bloomberg's The China Show.
 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Signals Land Strikes on Cartels After Maduro Operation | Daybreak Europe 1/9/2026
summary:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, US President Donald Trump says the US military is preparing for strikes against drug cartel facilities in Venezuela. His comments on Fox News come just days after capturing president Nicolas Maduro and would mark a significant escalation in the region.

Rio Tinto is in talks to buy Glencore in a deal that will create the world’s largest mining firm with a market value exceeding $200 billion. 

Today's guests: Origin Advocacy Principal Halie Craig, Middlesex University Interim Faculty Dean for Science and Technology, Klaus Dodds & Head of Investment Strategy for RBC Wealth Management in the British Isles and Asia, Frédérique Carrier (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ECB President Lagarde Rules Out French Presidential Bid
summary: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde has insisted she’s not interested in returning to French politics and making a bid in the presidential elections due in just 15 months. Lagarde spoke with Bloomberg's Francine Lacqua about Europe’s fragility, rising populism and how she stays calm during global shocks. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Hartree's Ed Morse Reacts to Trump Venezuela Oil Exec Meeting
summary: Ed Morse, Hartree Partners senior advisor, says Venezuela’s political uncertainty is a major risk for oil markets. He tells Romaine Bostick and Katie Greifeld on “The Close” that its vast oil reserves are also among the world’s most costly to produce. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Gave: Doubtful Oil Cos. Will Rush to Invest in Venezuela
summary: Gavekal Founding Partner and CEO Louis-Vincent Gave says he is doubtful whether oil companies will rush to invest in Venezuela. He speaks with Paul Allen on "Insight with Haslinda Amin." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Goldman Sachs' Best Strategies for Utilities Stocks in 2026
summary: Carly Davenport, U.S. utilities analyst at Goldman Sachs, says the firm expects increased natural gas use, fewer coal plant retirements, more nuclear power added to the grid, and continued growth in renewables. She speaks with Romaine Bostick and Katie Greifeld on “The Close.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump’s Tariffs Ruling; Rio Tinto, Glencore Merger | Horizons Middle East & Africa 1/9/2026
summary: Stocks swing as markets brace for the US payrolls report and a possible Supreme Court ruling on US President Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs. Also on the show: Rio Tinto and Glencore resuming talks to create what could become the world's biggest mining company; Zambia says it will seek a new loan program with the IMF; Saudi Arabia is moving to end the UAE's role in Yemen; security guarantees for Ukraine are a key sticking point as Trump seeks to broker a peace deal to end Russia's war. Guests include: Brett McGonegal, Capital Link, CEO; Casey Sprake, AG Capital, Market Strategist. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: House Committee Votes to Subpoena Wexner in Epstein Probe
summary:
A House committee voted Wednesday to subpoena billionaire retail tycoon Les Wexner in its investigation of the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
An email released by the Department of Justice last month revealed that law enforcement officials working on Epstein’s 2019 prosecution identified Wexner as one of 10 “co-conspirators.” Wexner wasn’t charged in the case. Representative Robert Garcia of California, the top-ranking Democrat on the House Oversight Committee, said he had secured the subpoena of Wexner. The executors of Epstein’s estate, Richard Kahn and Darren Indyke, also would be subpoenaed, he said. Bloomberg News Senior Investigative Reporter Jason Leopold joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss the subpoena, plus his latest FOIA Files Newsletter about data revealing DOGE hiring at the start of President Trump's second term. Leopold speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: IEA's Fmr. Oil Head: China Doesn't Need Venezuelan Oil
summary: Neil Atkinson, visiting fellow at the National Center for Energy Analytics and former IEA oil markets chief, says Venezuela’s oil industry has severely deteriorated. He tells Katie Greifeld and Romaine Bostick on “The Close” that China’s involvement is driven more by political influence than oil demand. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: India’s 7.4% Growth: Strong Signal or Misleading Headline?
summary:
India’s economy posted a 7.4% growth rate, but is it as robust as it seems?
On Insight with Haslinda Amin, India's former Chief Economic Advisor spoke to Menaka Doshi,  breaks down the numbers, warning against overconfidence. He highlights slowing nominal indicators, decelerating GDP trends, and external pressures like tariff shocks and geopolitical tensions.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Inside Europe’s Economic Crises With Lagarde
summary: Francine Lacqua speaks to Christine Lagarde about Europe’s fragility, rising populism and how she stays calm during global shocks. (Source: Bloomberg)

summary: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Kneron CEO on Business Strategy and Edge AI
summary: Albert Liu, CEO at Kneron, discusses the company's business strategy and the outlook for the edge AI market. He speaks with Shery Ahn and Annabelle Droulers from the sidelines of the CES trade show on "The Asia Trade".  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Lindsay Rosner on Jobs Report, Fed Monetary Policy, Mortgages
summary: Lindsay Rosner, head of multi-sector fixed income investing at Goldman Sachs Asset Management speaks with Scarlet Fu about the jobs report, Fed monetary policy and President Trump's mortgage bond announcement. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Meghan Robson on Credit Market, Saks Bonds Slump
summary: Meghan Robson, head of US credit strategy at BNP Paribas discusses the credit market and Sacs bond slump in an interview with Scarlet Fu on "Real Yield." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Meta Signs Massive Nuclear Deals for AI Data Centers
summary: Bloomberg's Will Wade explains the latest developments on Meta Platforms agreeing to multiple nuclear electricity deals to power new AI data centers. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Meta Signs Multi-Gigawatt Nuclear Deals to Power AI Data Centers
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. agreed to a series of electricity deals to power data centers that could end up totaling more than 6 gigawatts, enough to power a city of about 5 million homes. Will Wade reports on Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Meta Turns to Multi-Gigawatt Nuclear Deals for AI Data Centers
summary: Meta aims to future-proof its energy needs by turning to nuclear power in multi-gigawatt deals for AI data centers. Bloomberg’s Riley Griffin discusses Meta’s plan with Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Natixis CIB’s Narain on APAC M&A Outlook
summary: Raghu Narain, Head of APAC Investment Banking at Natixis CIB, shares his 2026 outlook on deal‑making across Asia Pacific — from M&A momentum to opportunities in tech, the energy transition, and regional growth. He joins Paul Allen exclusively on Bloomberg’s Insight with Haslinda Amin. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Navarro Urges EU to Impose Higher Tariffs on China
summary: Peter Navarro, White House trade adviser, says the European Union should "follow the US and Mexican lead" in imposing higher tariffs on China. He made the comments in an interview on The Mishal Husain Show. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: How Venezuelan Oil Is Reshaping US Foreign Policy

title: Admit It, You’re in a Relationship With AI

It turned out the opposite was true. Artificial intelligence tools were subtly manipulating people and displacing their need to ask others for advice. That was having a detrimental impact on real relationships with humans.

title: Trump, the symbol of a capitalism ever more voracious for oil and rare earths
summary: The Trump administration's desire to control Venezuelan oil and designs to take over Greenland aim to secure a supply of natural resources for the US, at a time when the planet is being drilled and exploited as never before.

title: US economy creates far fewer jobs under Trump than Biden
summary: In the United States, 584,000 jobs were created over 2025, far fewer than the 2 million that were generated in 2024, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: EU Commission considers enacting the EU-Mercosur trade deal before MEPs ratify it
summary: A qualified majority of European Union member states approved the deal, which the EU Commission had concluded with the South American countries at the end of 2024. Amid tensions, Commission President Ursula von der Leyen raised the possibility of implementing the deal before MEPs voted on it.

title: US oil majors show only moderate enthusiasm for Venezuelan oil, despite Trump's urging
summary: The president, who hosted industry representatives at the White House on Friday, urged them to rapidly invest in the South American country to exploit its vast reserves and guaranteed them Washington's protection.

title: What the US withdrawal from international bodies means for climate change and biodiversity
summary: The US's exit from the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change and its equivalent for biodiversity threatens to further slow and hinder the fight against environmental crises.

title: Germany deports man to Syria for first time since 2011
summary: The Syrian immigrant, who had previously been convicted of criminal offences in Germany, was flown to Damascus and handed over to Syrian authorities on Tuesday.

title: US recommends fewer childhood vaccines in major shift
summary: At the end of 2024, the Centers for Disease Control recommended 17 pediatric immunizations for all individuals. That number is now 11. President Donald Trump praised the changes, saying some of his base 'have been praying for these common sense reforms for many years.'

title: After prison in Belarus and forced exile, Nobel Peace Prize laureate Ales Bialiatski remains undeterred
summary: Belarusian human rights defender Ales Bialiatski, released on Saturday, December 13, after four and a half years in prison, spoke to Le Monde in Vilnius. He calls on the world 'not to leave Belarus in Russia's hands.'

title: Denmark blames cyberattacks on hacker groups linked to Russian state
summary: The Danish government said Thursday it would summon the Russian ambassador over cyberattacks affecting water systems and election campaigns that security officials claimed were carried out by hacker groups with ties to the Russian state.

title: Zelensky presses EU to tap Russian assets at crunch summit
summary: At a Brussels summit with exceptionally high stakes for both the EU and Ukraine, EU leaders are set to decide on whether to use tens of billions of euros in frozen Russian assets to meet Ukraine's military and financial needs over the next two years.

title: Brown University shooting suspect, a 48-year-old Portuguese national, found dead
summary: The man took his own life, according to police, who linked the suspect to the shooting death in Boston of a professor two days after the tragedy at Brown. The motives behind these attacks, which left three people dead, remain unknown.

title: EU strikes deal to provide €90 billion to Ukraine
summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said Friday the EU had sent a 'clear signal' to Russian leader Vladimir Putin by agreeing to send Kyiv the massive amount of funding.

title: EU to loan €90 billion to Ukraine while delaying Mercosur deal
summary: The aid allocated to Kyiv will take the form of a zero-interest loan, after the bloc failed to agree on using frozen Russian assets. Meanwhile, the free trade agreement with the South American Mercosur trade bloc was postponed to January, as Italy joined France in blocking it.

title: Spain's Socialist Party shaken by internal #MeToo scandal
summary: Several cases of sexual harassment have rocked the prime minister's party, already weakened by corruption scandals. The party's handling of the complaints has provoked a strong backlash from within, as Spain prepares for several upcoming regional elections in the coming months.

title: US says more than 70 targets hit in strikes against IS in Syria
summary: 'US forces commenced OPERATION HAWKEYE STRIKE in Syria to eliminate ISIS fighters, infrastructure, and weapons sites in direct response to the attack on US forces that occurred on December 13th,' Hegseth wrote Friday on X.

title: Pope Leo replaces pro-Trump cardinal with pro-migrant bishop from Chicago
summary: Ronald Hicks, a 58-year-old bishop from Illinois, will be formally installed on February 6. He has shown solidarity with migrants at a time when the US administration is ordering mass deportations and portraying migrants and refugees as criminals.

title: Rome to charge tourists for access to Trevi Fountain
summary: City officials said Friday that visitors will have to pay €2 to get close to the Italian capital's Trevi Fountain starting in February. The site has attracted an average of 30,000 tourists per day most of this year, Rome's mayor told reporters.

title: Rubio says deal won't be forced on Ukraine as Europeans join Miami talks
summary: Trump's global envoy Steve Witkoff and son-in-law Jared Kushner are leading the talks, which will include top Ukrainian negotiator Rustem Umerov as well as top officials from Britain, France and Germany. Rubio said that ultimately, both sides had to agree to a deal. 'There's no peace deal unless Ukraine agrees to it,' he told reporters on Friday.

title: TikTok signs joint venture deal to avoid US ban threat
summary: TikTok CEO Shou Chew told employees that the social media company and its Chinese owner ByteDance had agreed to the new entity. Oracle, Silver Lake and Abu Dhabi-based MGX are on board as major investors, the memo said.

title: Trump administration suspends green card lottery after Brown University shooting
summary: The green card lottery program grants up to 55,000 permanent resident visas annually. Its suspension was announced after a Portuguese green card holder, Claudio Neves Valente, was accused of a mass shooting at the Ivy League school.

title: Trump dogged by cost of living crisis and Republican revolt
summary: The US president tried to defuse Americans' dissatisfaction with the economy in a televised address on Wednesday. He continued to blame Joe Biden, but struggled to grasp the extent of the issue – provoking tensions within his own party.

title: Trump orders marijuana reclassified as a less dangerous drug
summary: The long-awaited move paves the way for further medical research on the use of cannabis products. Until now, the drug has been classified in the same category as drugs like heroin.

title: Trump shifts NASA priority to Moon mission, not Mars
summary: In an executive order, President Donald Trump shifted his previous goals for NASA, now aiming to get Americans to the Moon by 2028, instead of a goal to put the American flag on Mars before the end of his four-year term.

title: Trump announces lower drug price deals with 9 pharmaceutical companies
summary: The US President, on Friday, also vowed to urge US health insurance executives to voluntarily lower costs, as millions of Americans brace for a surge in premiums that could prove politically damaging for Republicans.

title: Putin says Russian troops 'are advancing' in Ukraine and threatens more if diplomacy fails
summary: Vladimir Putin said that Russia would 'still witness new successes' before the end of this year, during an annual press conference in Moscow. He also spoke about peace talks with Ukraine, an EU freeze on Russian assets and the Russian economy.

title: Bondi Beach surf lifesavers gather to honor victims of shooting
summary: Australian surf lifesavers lined Bondi Beach to observe three minutes of silence in memory of the 15 people who lost their lives. Volunteers across the country joined them in a show of solidarity with the Jewish community.

title: Finland faces yet another racist scandal
summary: The conservative prime minister apologized to China, Japan and South Korea after members of the far-right party in the government coalition made racist comments. Three elected officials expressed support for Miss Finland, who lost her crown after being photographed making a slant-eye gesture.

title: In Ukraine, Russian forces increasingly target the railway network
summary: Since the start of the year, the national rail company Ukrzaliznytsia has recorded more than 1,000 attacks. While most have been concentrated on stations near the Russian border and front line, the rest of the country has not been spared.

title: Lula and Milei clash over Venezuela at Mercosur summit
summary: The comments from the Brazilian and Argentinian leaders came at a meeting of the South American Mercosur bloc, at which a future trade deal with the European Union was on the agenda.

title: Musk wins US court appeal of $56 billion Tesla pay package
summary: Tesla's board has provided staunch support to Musk throughout the legal saga, approving in August 2025 an 'interim' compensation award worth about $29 billion for Musk and then unveiling a pay package worth as much as $1 trillion.

title: Pakistan court hands former PM Khan 17-year sentence in gifts case
summary: The ruling is the latest legal setback for Khan, who has faced a multitude of cases since his government was removed from power in 2022. Incarcerated since 2023, he has denied the charges and accused authorities of political persecution.

title: Putin signals readiness for a long war and promises 'new success'
summary: During an annual TV address on Friday, December 19, the Russian leader showed no signs of changing course on Russia's war on Ukraine, claiming that 'the ball is entirely in the court of Ukraine and its European sponsors.'

title: Trump's name added to Kennedy Center, one day after change
summary: The building's facade now has a sign that reads 'The Donald J. Trump and the John F. Kennedy Memorial Center For the Performing Arts.' Naming a national institution after a sitting president is unprecedented in US history, and members of the Kennedy family questioned whether the change was legal.

title: US Justice Department begins release of Epstein files, including previously unseen photos of Clinton
