summary: The vast disclosure from investigations into the politically explosive case of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein – now deceased – included seven pages listing 254 masseuses – every name obscured beneath thick black bars. Among the photographs released on Friday included a younger-looking Bill Clinton reclining in a hot tub.

title: Zelensky says US mooted direct Ukraine-Russia talks on ending war in Miami
summary: The Ukrainian president said that Washington had proposed the first face-to-face negotiations between Ukraine and Russia in half a year, as diplomats converged on Miami for fresh talks on ending the war.

title: Bangladesh: Assassination of student protest leader sparks violence and heightens tensions with India
summary: The assailants who killed the young man reportedly fled to India, where former prime minister Sheikh Hasina has also taken refuge after being forced to resign following the protests of August 2024.

title: Freed Belarusian opposition figure Sergei Tikhanovsky returns to politics
summary: Sentenced to 18 years in prison and released in June, the renowned opposition figure told Le Monde that the political strategy of his wife, exiled leader of the democratic forces, Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya, has 'failed' and lays out his alternative vision for a 'neutral Belarus.'

title: Hosts Morocco open Africa Cup of Nations under heavy expectations
summary: Fresh off their Arab Cup triumph in Qatar on Thursday, Morocco begins the Africa Cup of Nations on home soil on Sunday hoping to thrill its fans and finally end a 49-year wait for continental glory.

title: Israel's security cabinet approves 19 new settlements in West Bank
summary: Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move is aimed at preventing the establishment of a Palestinian state. It comes days after the UN said the expansion of Israeli settlements in the West Bank had reached its highest level since at least 2017.

title: Khan Yunis: Occupied, bombed, razed and divided by Israel
summary: The centuries-old city of Khan Yunis, located in the Gaza Strip, has paid a heavy price for its central role in Palestinian nationalism, to the point that it is now divided by Israel's so-called 'yellow line,' writes Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column for Le Monde.

title: Putin's readiness to speak with Macron 'welcome,' says French presidency
summary: The Elysée stressed, however, that any discussion with Russia would be conducted in 'full transparency' with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and European allies.

title: US and Ukraine hail 'productive' Miami talks without reaching breakthrough
summary: US and Ukrainian envoys have been in southern Florida for the past three days for a series of meetings, with 'particular attention' paid to 'the sequencing of next steps.'

title: Australian state pushes tough gun laws and implements ban on 'terror symbols' after mass shooting
summary: A week after a father and son targeted a Hanukkah event, killing 15 people – the nation's deadliest mass shooting in almost three decades – the government of the populous New South Wales introduced the country's strictest gun laws, as well as a ban on 'terrorist symbols.'

title: Cambodia accuses Thailand of launching air strikes near Angkor temple site
summary: The announcement came shortly after Thailand and Cambodia agreed, following regional talks in Malaysia on Monday, to hold direct discussions on Wednesday, in an effort to resolve their border dispute.

title: Deadly clashes in Aleppo as Turkey urges Kurds not to be obstacle to Syria's stability
summary: On Monday, both the Syrian government and Kurdish-led forces ordered their fighters to cease fire following deadly clashes that led to at least three people killed.

title: Denmark summons US ambassador after Trump names Greenland envoy
summary: Donald Trump announced early Monday that he had named the governor of Louisiana, Jeff Landry, as US special envoy to Greenland. In response, the European Union said the bloc stands in 'full solidarity' with Denmark.

title: Former Israeli PM accuses Netanyahu's office of treason over alleged Qatar funding
summary: Israeli former prime minister Naftali Bennett called for the resignation of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who is accused of having been recruited by Qatar to promote the Gulf monarchy's image in Israel.

title: Gaza: The Latin patriarch of Jerusalem honors Christians, who remain 'steadfast' in a 'sea of destruction'
summary: Cardinal Pierbattista Pizzaballa, head of the Catholic Church in the Holy Land, made another visit to the Gaza Strip to celebrate Christmas Mass. The vast majority of the Christian community, now down to just 600 people, is still sheltering within the parish.

title: In Austria, the rebellion of three nuns from the Goldenstein convent
summary: The sisters claim they were financially stripped and forced to leave their religious establishment to move into a nursing home. Thanks to the support of volunteers, they have 'escaped' and have since returned to their former monastery.

title: Multiple gunmen open fire at a South African pub, killing nine and wounding 10
summary: In recent years, there have been several mass shootings at bars in South Africa, which has one of the highest homicide rates in the world.

title: NBA and FIBA announce search for teams for a potential European league
summary: The National Basketball Association and International Basketball Federation said they would begin prospecting basketball teams and owners for a planned pan-European men's basketball league.

title: Nigeria sees last 130 kidnapped Catholic schoolchildren freed and given to the authorities
summary: 303 students and 12 teachers had been reported kidnapped from St. Mary's co-educational boarding school, located in north-central Nigeria. Around 100 of the children were released at the beginning of December.

title: Nigerian government frees 130 kidnapped Catholic schoolchildren
summary: The remaining schoolchildren who were abducted from a Catholic school in November have been released, though it has not been made public who seized the children from their boarding school, nor how the government secured their release.

title: Russia pledges 'full support' for Venezuela against US 'hostilities'
summary: US forces have launched strikes on boats it says, without providing evidence, were trafficking drugs in the Caribbean Sea and eastern Pacific Ocean since September. More than 100 people have been killed.

title: Senior Russian general killed in Moscow car blast
summary: Investigators said they opened a probe into the 'murder' of Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov, with the possibility that the attack was 'linked' to 'Ukrainian special forces' among the lines of inquiry.

title: Syria through a photographer's lens: 'We began working on stories that Assad's regime forbade us to cover'
summary: One year ago, a group of Syrian rebels announced they had taken Damascus, ending the rule of Bashar al-Assad. Photographer Laurence Geai has since traveled to the country three times for Le Monde. She shares her work with us.

title: Trump administration denies cover-up over redacted Epstein files
summary: Jeffrey Epstein's victims have expressed anger over the partial and heavily-censored release of documents. Though Trump officials said they were protecting Epstein's victims with the blackouts, the many redactions have only added to calls for justice in a case that continues to fuel conspiracy theories from the president's base.

title: Ukraine peace talks stall as Putin says ready for dialogue with Macron
summary: After Trump's envoys held three days of talks between Ukrainian and Russian representatives in Miami, alongside French, German and British emissaries, the negotiations once again stalled over territorial issues.

title: Vance, Trump's heir apparent, defends his Christian nationalism at Turning Point conference
summary: The US vice president gave the closing speech at the Turning Point USA conference in Phoenix on December 21. He followed Donald Trump's line, all while spouting ideological rhetoric rooted in Christian nationalism. He told the audience: 'You don't have to apologize for being White anymore.'

title: For the future French aircraft carrier, Macron announces new ship 'in an era of predators'
summary: The French president has confirmed the construction of a replacement for the Charles-de-Gaulle aircraft carrier, set to enter service in 2038. With a crew of 2,000 sailors, the new ship will be able to carry 30 fighter jets, several types of aerial drones and numerous electronic warfare systems.

title: Greenland PM says 'our decisions are made here' after Trump remarks
summary: Most of Greenland's 57,000 people want to become independent from Denmark but do not wish to become part of the United States, according to an opinion poll in January.

title: Greta Thunberg arrested at pro-Palestinian protest in London
summary: Thunberg's arrest makes her the highest-profile person to be detained by police since the government banned the Palestine Action group under anti-terror laws.

title: Is the Thanksgiving turkey a Democrat?
summary: 'My Christmas under Trump' (1/5). French journalist Georgia Husson moved to New York as the city geared up for the winter holidays. She recounts the Friendsgiving hosted by a group of friends in Connecticut, where political opinions clashed.

title: Israel NGO registration rules could lead to collapse of aid into Gaza
summary: New administrative rules imposed on international organizations have already led to the exclusion of several groups from the Palestinian enclave. Humanitarian actors say they are deeply concerned for civilians.

title: Libya's top military chief killed in plane crash in Turkey
summary: The head of Libya's armed forces, Lieutenant General Mohammed al-Haddad, was killed along with four other passengers when their business jet crashed shortly after taking off from Ankara.

title: New rules for leaving Ukraine accelerate exodus of a generation of young adults
summary: A law passed at the end of August allowing men aged 18 to 22 to temporarily leave Ukrainian territory has enabled young people to maintain ties with their families. But the measure has raised concerns among military officials and business leaders.

title: US appointment of special envoy to Greenland sparks outrage in Denmark
summary: In a post on X, Louisiana Governor Jeff Landry – appointed by Donald Trump – said his goal is to 'make Greenland a part of the US.' In response, Denmark's Foreign Ministry has summoned the US ambassador to Copenhagen.

title: War in Ukraine: Russia grapples with third assassination of a senior officer
summary: Russian investigators suspect that Ukrainian secret services were behind the car bomb attack that killed Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov. In 2024, Vladimir Putin called another senior officer's murder a 'serious failure.'

title: Algeria demands 'apologies' and 'reparations' from France for its colonial past
summary: Algerian MPs passed a law on Wednesday, December 24, to 'criminalize French colonization,' amid ongoing diplomatic tensions between Algiers and Paris.

title: Czech Prime Minister Andrej Babis gradually distances himself from support for Ukraine
summary: Back at the helm of the Czech government since early December, populist Andrej Babis has sought to distance himself from the strongly pro-Kyiv stance of his predecessor, while stopping short of aligning with Russia. His defense minister, who has voiced clear support for Ukraine, was sharply reprimanded.

title: Digital regulation: Thierry Breton faces sanctions as US-EU dispute intensifies
summary: Former EU commissioner Thierry Breton, who led tech sector regulation efforts, is now barred from having a US visa. The Trump administration condemned the EU's online content moderation measures as 'censorship.'

title: 'Drone overflights are testing our defense capabilities,' says French military intelligence and security chief
summary: Despite heightened vigilance from his teams, General Aymeric Bonnemaison, director of the French military security agency, admits that it remains difficult to identify the culprits of suspicious incidents. Since September, there has been a sharp increase in drone overflights of military installations.

title: EU 'strongly condemns' US sanctions against five Europeans over digital regulation
summary: After the Trump administration sanctioned five European figures over the EU's digital regulations, which it dubbed 'censorship,' the EU, France and Germany have reacted by denouncing the move.

title: From Trump Tower to Queens, in search of the perfect Christmas tree
summary: 'My Christmas under Trump' (2/5). Journalist Georgia Husson settled in New York right in the middle of the holiday season preparations. Today, she wanders through the city in search of the perfect decorations for the (expensive) conifer.

title: In New York, the invasion of drunken Santas
summary: 'My Christmas under Trump' (3/5). Journalist Georgia Husson settled in New York right in the middle of the holiday season preparations. In her latest dispatch, she dives into the Santa Claus convention, where every December 13, locals dress up in honor of the mythical bearded figure – a perfect pretext for a marathon bar crawl.

title: New batch of Epstein files contains multiple Trump references
summary: The US president is featured prominently in the thousands of documents that were just published, underlining his close ties to Jeffrey Epstein. The Justice Department issued a statement shortly after the files dropped, saying some documents 'contain untrue and sensationalist claims made against President Trump.'

title: Syria says detained senior IS jihadist in Damascus
summary: Taha al-Zoubi, also known as Abu Omar Tabiya, was arrested by Syrian authorities in a joint operation with a US-led international coalition.

title: Trump-backed Asfura declared winner of Honduras presidency
summary: Nasry Asfura, a conservative businessman, defeated fellow conservative TV personality Salvador Nasralla, who had demanded a full recount due to alleged irregularities. Within minutes of the declaration of the result, the United States welcomed his victory, saying it would help stop illegal immigration.

title: Ukraine loses Siversk, a bastion guarding the last quarter of the Donetsk region
summary: The Russian invading army has completed its occupation of the city of 10,000 inhabitants, which had held out for three and a half years. The eastern flank of the last conurbation in the Donbas that is still under Ukrainian control now seems exposed.

title: Zelensky unveils latest peace plan draft backed by US, setting conditions for demilitarized zone in the Donbas
summary: The Ukrainian president opens the door to creating a demilitarized zone supervised by 'international forces' in the part of the Donbas controlled by Kyiv, making the withdrawal of Ukrainian troops conditional on the withdrawal of Russian forces.

title: Bethlehem celebrates Christmas in climate of 'fear and uncertainty'
summary: The city authorities have scaled back Christian holiday festivities since October 7, 2023, attack. Celebrations have now resumed, against a backdrop of economic catastrophe and Israeli settlement expansion across the West Bank.

title: Escaping New York's winter and its 'communist' mayor for Miami
summary: 'My Christmas under Trump' (4/5). Journalist Georgia Husson settled in New York right in the middle of the holiday season preparations. Just a few hours' flight from the Big Apple, the state draws wealthy New Yorkers in search of sunshine, peace and quiet and extravagant gifts.

title: Explosion at Nigerian mosque kills five
summary: The bomb went off inside a crowded mosque in Maiduguri's Gamboru market, as Muslim faithful gathered for evening prayers. The capital of Borno state is home to a years-long insurgency by jihadist groups, though the city itself has not seen a major attack in years.

title: In his first Christmas as pope, Leo XIV denounces a 'distorted economy'
summary: During the mass in Rome, Leo said Christmas was a feast of 'faith, charity and hope' and criticized a 'distorted economy' that 'leads us to treat human beings as mere merchandise'.

title: In Turkey, the fall of a star television presenter exposes internal power struggles
summary: The influential television host, Mehmet Akif Ersoy, has been arrested as part of a drug trafficking investigation and placed in provisional detention.

title: Partial annulment of presidential vote results in Bosnia's Serb entity
summary: Bosnia's electoral commission on Wednesday annulled results at 136 polling stations over 'irregularities' from November's snap vote to choose a successor to the banned president of the Bosnian Serb statelet.

title: Pope urges Russia, Ukraine dialogue in Christmas blessing
summary: In his first Christmas message, speaking to a crowd of some 26,000 people in St Peter's Square, Leo XIV also discussed the dire humanitarian situation in Gaza.

title: Zelensky says he held talks on Ukraine with US envoys
summary: The Ukrainian president spoke with US President Donald Trump's envoys Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, focusing on ending the 'brutal Russian war.'

title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak convicted in corruption scandal
summary: Najib Razak was found guilty on multiple counts of abuse of power and money laundering tied to more than $700 million siphoned into his personal bank accounts from the 1MDB state investment fund.

title: In Belarus, the shadow political prisoners
summary: Beyond the roughly 1,000 political prisoners who have been officially identified, hundreds more languish in prison without being recorded. The regime of Alexander Lukashenko has done everything it can to keep them hidden and ensure they are forgotten.

title: Mariupol, Ukraine: A model city of 'new Russia'
summary: Since 2015, photographer Gabriele Micalizzi has been documenting the Donbas region from the Russian side of the front line, an area where Moscow enforces very strict access conditions for journalists. In November, he secured permission to enter Donetsk Oblast, a region of occupied Ukraine, and traveled to Mariupol, a city destroyed by Russian forces in 2022, which has since been colonized and rebuilt in record time.

title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un orders factories to make more missiles in 2026
summary: In a visit to munitions factories accompanied by top officials, the state-run Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) said the North Korean leader had ordered the factories to prepare for a busy year ahead.

title: Prosecutors seek 10-year sentence for ousted South Korea president over martial law bid
summary: An independent counsel has asked a Seoul court to jail Yoon Suk Yeol for several charges, including obstruction of justice and abuse of power, in the first of a series of trials linked to his 2024 declaration of martial law.

title: Russians are evading sanctions with fake Romanian documents
summary: Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, hundreds of Russian citizens have reportedly obtained Romanian citizenship through fraudulent means, allowing them to circumvent sanctions or settle in the European Union.

title: Trump orders strikes on 'terrorists' in Nigeria, bolstering cooperation with Abuja
summary: The December 25 operation marks Donald Trump's first major action against armed groups in the West African country. In November, he had vowed to target 'terrorists' who he claimed had attacked 'Christians.'

title: US launches deadly strikes on Islamic State targets in Nigeria
summary: The attacks mark the first by US forces in Nigeria under Trump, and come after the Republican berated the West African nation in October and November, saying Christians there faced an 'existential threat' that amounted to 'genocide' amid Nigeria's myriad armed conflicts.

title: Turkey detains dozens of IS suspects planning attacks on Christmas and New Year's celebrations
summary: Some 115 alleged members of the Islamic State group suspected of planning attacks during the end-of-year holidays have been arrested in Turkey, Istanbul's prosecutor general said on Thursday. The arrests come days after the Trump administration launched widespread military strikes in neighboring Syria to 'eliminate' IS fighters.

title: Where have all the New York City children gone?
summary: 'My Christmas under Trump' (5/5). Journalist Georgia Husson settled in New York right in the middle of the holiday season preparations. Today, she recounts her impossible quest to find a gift for her young goddaughter. It would be easier if it were for a dog.

title: Algiers revives its dream of a Hollywood epic for Emir Abd El-Kader
summary: After several failed attempts, a film is set to be dedicated to this hero of resistance against French colonial conquest, with the active support of President Abdelmadjid Tebboune.

title: Côte d'Ivoire's divided opposition fights for survival in legislative elections
summary: Weakened by a campaign of repression and internal divisions, these political parties hope to prevent President Alassane Ouattara's party from securing an absolute majority in Parliament on Saturday, December 27.

title: In Israel, survivors of the Tribe of Nova festival face trauma alone
summary: More than two years after October 7, the 3,750 survivors of the massacre carried out by Hamas remain in deep distress and feel abandoned by authorities.

title: Israel moves toward Netanyahu-led October 7 inquiry as Qatar scandal deepens
summary: The Knesset passed a bill in its first reading to establish a special commission of inquiry into the failures of October 7, in line with the wishes of Benjamin Netanyahu, who has rejected the idea of a more independent body. However, he now faces difficulties over his advisers' ties to Qatar.

title: Laos' 4,000 Islands archipelago grapples with China's economic expansion
summary: The 'Siphandone Special Economic Zone' on the Mekong River has been granted to Chinese investors for 99 years. They harbor grand ambitions but are struggling to realize them, with construction projects at a standstill.

title: Russia strikes Kyiv overnight, killing one person and knocking out power to hundreds of thousands
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said the attack, which comes ahead of his latest talks with US leader Donald Trump, shows that Russia has no intention of ending the war.

title: Russian patriotism and military spirit are instilled in children from pre-school
summary: Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, the Kremlin has encouraged 'cadet' programs at schools in the country for children from the age of 4, who learn to march, obey orders and handle weapons.

title: Somalia and African Union condemn Israel's recognition of Somaliland
summary: Mogadishu has denounced the move as an attack on its sovereignty, while regional and African leaders warn it could destabilize the Horn of Africa.

title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to new ceasefire after weeks of deadly border fighting
summary: The truce halts all military action along the disputed frontier after nearly a month of clashes that killed at least 47 people and displaced more than one million civilians.

title: US and Nigeria offer diverging accounts of strikes on militants
summary: Washington and Abuja agree that the Christmas-timed operation targeted Islamic State-linked militants, but they give conflicting accounts of which groups were struck and how the attacks were carried out.

title: Yemen separatists defy alleged Saudi air strikes as tensions escalate
summary: Emirati-backed separatists in Yemen said they would press ahead with their campaign to restore an independent south after air strikes blamed on Saudi Arabia hit their positions.

title: After five years of civil war, Myanmar junta stages an election
summary: The ruling junta touted the vote – which has been criticized by Western diplomats and the UN rights chief – as a return to democracy. Former civilian leader Aung San Suu Kyi remains in jail.

title: Bangladesh student protest group forms election alliance with Islamists
summary: The Jamaat said on Sunday that it had reached an agreement with the student-led National Citizen Party. Some NCP members cautioned against the move. The majority-Muslim country has been in turmoil since the 2024 student uprising, and the resurgence of Islamist forces has raised concern among religious minorities.

title: Chile election: 'The trauma of the 2020 protest movement has fueled the country's conservative shift'
summary: Claudia Heiss, a political scientist at the University of Chile, analyzes the factors behind the popular vote that brought the ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast to power on December 14.

title: Guinea faces the ghosts of dictatorship: 'We have a terrible past and a worrying future'
summary: As Guinea's December 28 presidential election approaches, with little doubt surrounding General Mamadi Doumbouya's victory, the coup leader has increasingly cited Sékou Touré, the father of Guinea's independence. It risks reopening wounds from a dark time for part of the population.

title: War in Ukraine: Zelensky travels to Florida to secure Trump's support
summary: Four days after unveiling a 'draft agreement' to end the war, the Ukrainian president is due to meet his US counterpart in Florida on Sunday to address outstanding issues and show that Moscow – not Kyiv – remains the obstacle to peace.

title: 2025: The year Europe weakened Ukraine by abandoning the Gaza Strip
summary: Jean-Pierre Filiu writes in his weekly column that the European Union finds itself less able to withstand Donald Trump's blows to international law in Ukraine, having itself condoned such violations in Gaza.

title: China announces 'major' military exercises around Taiwan
summary: Beijing's latest show of force follows a round of arms sales to Taipei by the United States. Taiwan's Defense Ministry condemned China as the 'greatest destroyer of peace,' and the Taiwanese military said it had established a response center with 'appropriate forces.'

title: Deadly violence erupts during protests in Syria's Alawite regions
summary: Three people were killed and dozens injured in protests in the city of Homs on December 28, two days after a mosque bombing that killed eight members of the Alawite minority group, from which Bashar al-Assad hails.

title: Europe's dramatic decline in pharmaceutical production threatens health sovereignty
summary: The rise of China and India, combined with protectionist pressure from the Trump administration, is redrawing the global map of the pharmaceutical industry. The Europe-wide deindustrialization that began in the 2000s is now accelerating.

title: Immigrants in Chile fear for their future after a far-right leader won the presidential election
summary: José Antonio Kast, president-elect since December 14, focused his campaign on the fight against undocumented immigration. Many have urged outgoing President Gabriel Boric to regularize undocumented migrants before his term ends.

title: Israel: The MAGA world's new obsession
summary: As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is expected to meet with US President Donald Trump in Miami on Monday, December 29, Israel has become a source of contention and fantasy within the Trump movement.

title: Guinea: Junta leader Mamady Doumbouya is slated to win presidential election
summary: Doumbouya, who has cracked down on civil liberties, reneged on a pledge not to stand for office and to return the country to civilian rule by 2024. The main opposition leaders were barred from standing.

title: Peace between Russia and Ukraine is still elusive after Trump and Zelensky's meeting
summary: Despite the US and Ukrainian presidents congratulating themselves about the outcome of their meeting on Sunday, the prospect of an agreement to end the nearly four-year war between Kyiv and Moscow still seems far off.

title: The issues at stake in the Netanyahu-Trump meeting: Gaza, Iran, Syria and Lebanon
summary: While Benjamin Netanyahu, who will be in Mar-a-Lago, Florida, on Monday, is expected to make concessions on the Palestinian enclave, he is likely to push Donald Trump for a more aggressive stance on Iran.

title: Trump says Ukraine deal closer than ever, but no apparent breakthrough after talks
summary: A day after Russia unleashed major new attacks on residential areas of Kyiv, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky visited the US president in Mar-a-Lago. Zelensky said that the peace framework laid out by Trump was '90% agreed' and that he and European leaders could return to Washington for talks with Trump in January.

title: Trump confirms US destroyed dock for Venezuela drug boats
summary: The American president has indicated that the US had 'hit' a dock facility along a shore. The move could mark the first land strike of the military campaign against trafficking from Latin America.

title: Russia declines to provide proof of alleged drone attack on Putin's home, says will 'toughen' negotiating stance
summary: 'I don't think there should be any evidence if such a massive drone attack is being carried out,' the Kremlin spokesperson said on Tuesday. He added Russia would 'toughen' its stance in talks on ending the Ukraine after the alleged attack, which Kyiv denies.

title: Bangladesh's former prime minister Khaleda Zia dies at 80
summary: Despite years of ill health and imprisonment, Zia had vowed in November to campaign in elections set for February 2026, the first vote since a mass uprising toppled her arch-rival Sheikh Hasina last year. Her son is now expected to be put forward as prime minister if the Bangladesh Nationalist Party wins a majority.

title: Berlin's dangerous fascination with homemade firecrackers and fireworks
summary: Police unions and doctors' associations are calling for a ban on the private use of pyrotechnic devices, which cause injuries every New Year's Eve. But the German capital defends its libertarian spirit and its festive reputation.

title: China conducts second day of military drills around Taiwan with port blockade simulation
summary: Beijing's military on Tuesday dispatched air, navy and missile units to conduct joint live-fire drills around the island of Taiwan, which Beijing called a 'stern warning' against separatist and 'external interference' forces.

title: Israeli drones make life miserable for residents of southern Lebanon
summary: The constant presence of surveillance and attack drones flying over the border region is putting pressure on the Lebanese population and fueling fears of a return to full-scale war.

title: UAE to withdraw remaining forces from Yemen amid separatist offensive
summary: Abu Dhabi said Tuesday it is pulling its counter-terrorism teams from Yemen, following a Saudi demand to withdraw within 24 hours amid a surge by UAE-backed separatists.

title: Trump puts differences with Netanyahu aside, sends warnings to Hamas and Iran
summary: While Washington recently expressed frustration over the stalled Gaza peace plan, the two leaders displayed strong unity on Monday in Florida, with the US president reminding Hamas of its obligations and threatening Tehran over the possible resumption of its nuclear program.

title: Trump warns Hamas and Iran after Netanyahu talks in Mar-a-Lago
summary: Speaking at a news conference with the Israeli prime minister in Florida, Trump said Hamas would have 'hell to pay' if it fails to disarm in Gaza. He also threatened to 'eradicate' any attempt by Tehran to rebuild its nuclear program or ballistic missile arsenal following US and Israeli strikes earlier this year.

title: US defends Israel's right to recognize Somaliland
summary: Although Donald Trump refuses to recognize this self-proclaimed republic that seceded from Somalia, the US representative to the United Nations has drawn a parallel between Israel's decision and the recognition of Palestine by several countries.

title: US sanctions Iran-Venezuela drone network amid Maduro pressure
summary: The United States Treasury targeted 10 Iranian and Venezuelan individuals and entities over drone and missile-related dealings as part of Washington's wider push against Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's government.

title: Artists cancel shows at Washington's premier performing arts center after name changed to Trump-Kennedy Center
summary: Family members of the late President John F. Kennedy and Democratic politicians have expressed outrage after the name was changed from the Kennedy Center to the Trump-Kennedy Center. Several artists, including a prominent jazz group and dance company, have since canceled shows in protest.

title: China raises prices of condoms and birth control pills in attempt to boost birth rate
summary: Starting January 1, Beijing will impose a tax on contraceptives, risking limiting access to condoms in a country where 97% of new HIV cases are transmitted sexually.

title: EU accuses Russia of 'derailing real progress toward peace' with 'unfounded claims'
summary: Kaja Kallas, head of European diplomacy, described Russian accusations of an attack on Vladimir Putin's residence as a 'deliberate distraction.' On Wednesday, the Russian Defense Ministry released a video purportedly showing a Ukrainian drone shot down during the attack.

title: Israel warns it will suspend aid organizations operating in Gaza
summary: The Ministry of Diaspora Affairs and Combating Antisemitism also accused two Doctors Without Borders employees of links to militant groups and that the latest move is part of Israel's decision to 'strengthen and update' regulations that govern international NGOs in Palestinian territory.

title: Mamady Doumbouya, Guinea junta chief who pledged not to run for office, elected president
summary: The junta leader secured 86.72% of the first-round vote, but main opposition leaders were barred from running. Doumbouya led a coup to topple Guinea's first freely elected president in 2021.

title: New Year's Eve 2015 in Cologne: The night that traumatized thousands of women and shook Germany
summary: On New Year's Eve in 2015, more than 1,000 women were sexually assaulted in Cologne by groups of men, many from North Africa and the Middle East, triggering a fierce debate over Germany's refugee policy. Ten years on, victims say their trauma was politicized, as they continue to live with the consequences of that night.

title: No evidence found of alleged Ukrainian drone attack on Putin's residence
summary: Despite accusations leveled by Russia, no strike has been documented around the presidential estate, located 400 kilometers northwest of Moscow. Kyiv, which condemned the claim as a 'lie,' sees in it a pretext for the Kremlin to intensify its strikes and toughen its stance in US-led peace negotiations.

title: Taiwan says Chinese ships 'withdrawing' after drills
summary: China launched missiles and deployed fighter jets, navy ships and coastguard vessels around Taiwan on Monday and Tuesday in live-fire drills aimed at simulating a blockade of the self-ruled island. China said Wednesday it had 'successfully completed' the drills.

title: Tatiana Schlossberg, John F. Kennedy's granddaughter, dies aged 35
summary: A science and climate reporter for 'The New York Times,' she had been diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia.

title: Trump says he is dropping push for National Guard in Chicago, LA and Portland, for now
summary: 'We will come back, perhaps in a much different and stronger form, when crime begins to soar again - Only a question of time!' Trump wrote on Wednesday in a social media post. The president's push to deploy troops in Democrat-led cities has been met with legal challenges at nearly every turn.

title: Trump takes the lead as the US celebrates 250 years of independence
summary: Ahead of the anniversary of the 1776 Declaration of Independence, Americans are urged to celebrate the nation's history and ideals of exceptionalism, as Donald Trump moves to gain control over anniversary events alongside a nonpartisan commission created in 2016.

title: Amsterdam church burns amidst 'unprecedented' New Year's Eve violence against police
summary: With The Netherlands expected to ban fireworks in 2026, a rowdy New Year's Eve led to injuries and two deaths due to firework accidents.

title: Brazil Supreme Court rejects Bolsonaro request for house arrest
summary: The far-right former president's lawyers submitted the request Wednesday, citing a 'real risk of a sudden worsening' in health as the reason for him to serve his 27-year sentence for plotting a coup at home.

title: China military drills near Taiwan 'unnecessarily' raise tensions, says US State Department
summary: In a statement released on Thursday, US State Department spokesman Tommy Pigott urged Beijing to 'cease its military pressure against Taiwan and instead engage in meaningful dialogue.'

title: Shocked silence at vigil for Swiss fire victims
summary: Swiss President Guy Parmelin described the fire as 'one of the worst tragedies that our country has experienced.' Around 40 people were killed and 115 were injured, including at least two French citizens.

title: Iran's growing economic protests leave at least seven dead
summary: The protests, taking root in economic issues, have heard demonstrators chant against Iran's theocracy as well. The country's leaders are still reeling after Israel launched a 12-day war against the country in June.

title: Israel says 'will enforce' ban on 37 NGOs in Gaza
summary: The government said that these international aid groups, including Doctors Without Borders, World Vision International and Oxfam, had not complied with a deadline to disclose information on their Palestinian staff. They will be required to cease their operations by March 1.

title: Kharkiv ends the year amid bombs and Christmas lights
summary: Despite the ever-present sound of air-raid sirens, the city in eastern Ukraine decided to deck itself out in Christmas colors to recapture some festive spirit. Yet the semblance of normalcy remains difficult for some residents to fully embrace.

title: Iran's protests led by shopkeepers is shaking up the regime
summary: The collapse of the rial currency deepens the economic struggles faced by retailers, who have taken to the streets in several major cities. Some universities in Tehran have also joined the mobilization, as economic grievances merge with increasingly political slogans.

title: Taiwanese president vows to defend sovereignty in New Year's speech
summary: 'My stance has always been clear: to steadfastly defend national sovereignty, strengthen national defense and whole-of-society resilience,'  Lai Ching-te said. His speech comes amidst Chinese military drills this week around the self-ruled island and a domestic political crisis.

title: Togo releases Frenchman detained over anti-government protests
summary: Steeve Rouyar, a 44-year-old father of two originally from Guadeloupe, was arrested in June. 'A decision by the Togolese judiciary' allowed his release, the French foreign ministry said.

title: Trump bashes George Clooney and France after actor acquires French citizenship
summary: The US president, whose administration has backed anti-immigration parties in Europe, said key ally France had a 'horrendous' problem with crime and immigration.

title: US military strikes three more alleged drug boats, killing three
summary: A statement released on Wednesday by US Southern Command, which oversees South America, did not reveal where the attacks occurred. Previous attacks have been in the Caribbean Sea and in the eastern Pacific Ocean.

title: Mamdani sworn in as New York's mayor, vows city will 'set an example for the world'
summary: The new mayor inherits a city where crime and unemployment have dropped, but he faces an uphill battle to address the affordability crisis and Trump.

title: China's plan for London mega-embassy stokes controversy
summary: Beijing acquired Royal Mint Court in 2018 with the aim of relocating its embassy in the United Kingdom there. Housing Minister Steve Reed had until December 10 to make a decision on this major project, but the deadline was postponed for the third consecutive time to January 2026.

title: How four years of war in Ukraine redefined the European Union
summary: With Russia's aggression against Ukraine, the world that saw the construction of EU has all but disappeared. The 27 member states belatedly recognized that peace was 'no longer a given in Europe,' and awoke to their military weakness and energy dependence.

title: Mamdani, inaugurated as New York mayor, must now deliver on promises that secured his victory
summary: The young politician, the first Muslim to lead the largest city in the US and firmly on the left, filled his inauguration ceremony on Thursday with symbolic gestures. Elected on a pledge to make New York more affordable, he said he intends to govern 'expansively and audaciously.'

title: Poland's iconic 1989 round table consigned to museum
summary: This symbolic piece of furniture, on which communist leaders and democratic activists reached agreement, is leaving the presidential palace. The decision by nationalist President Karol Nawrocki is sparking debate in the country.

title: Pope Leo opens 2026 with plea for peace in countries bloodied by war, families wounded by violence
summary: During a New Year's Day Mass in St. Peter's Basilica, the pope prayed for peace among 'nations bloodied by conflict,' taking care to note that January 1 marks the church's World Day of Peace.

title: Russia unleashes mass plunder of Ukrainian homes in occupied areas
summary: A law signed by Vladimir Putin on December 15, 2025, encourages large-scale expropriation of property owners in areas occupied by the Russian army. Kyiv condemns the move as 'population replacement.'

title: Saudi-led coalition strike on UAE-backed forces in Yemen kills 20
summary: The movement, backed by the United Arab Emirates, reported on Friday that new Saudi strikes had killed 20 members of its forces, which had seized large swathes of the country in recent weeks.

title: Small boat migrants reached UK in near record numbers in 2025
summary: Home Office data showed a total of 41,472 migrants landed on England's southern coast in 2025 after making the perilous Channel crossing from northern France.

title: Switzerland in shock after tragic bar fire: 'It was a war zone. Burned hair, faces and hands'
summary: The upscale French-speaking Alpine resort of Crans-Montana is in mourning after a fire in a bar claimed the lives of around 40 people and left 115 others seriously injured. Heart-wrenching testimonies and unanswered questions are pouring in.

title: Trump declares US will 'come to their rescue' if Iran kills protesters
summary: The US president added that his country is 'locked and loaded and ready to go' as protests that started over economic stagnation and inflation sweep across Iran.

title: French managers of Swiss bar face criminal probe after fire
summary: The two owners of Le Constellation bar at the Swiss resort of Crans-Montana said that they followed all safety norms.

title: In Khartoum, the faces of a martyred capital: 'War cannot kill ideas, nor love'
summary: War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation (3/6). Le Monde's reporters traveled through the Sudanese capital, which for two years was the epicenter of the conflict. They met with residents, who recounted how they survived despite fear and violence.

title: In photos: A historic night of US strikes in Venezuela
summary: Around 2 am on Saturday, residents of Caracas were jolted awake by the sound of American bombings. At daybreak, Venezuelan military vehicles drove through the nearly deserted streets.

title: In Rio de Janeiro, New Year's Eve celebration sparks debate over secularism
summary: Mayor Eduardo Paes (centrist) set aside one of the city's music stages for gospel, a genre closely tied to evangelical worship. He has faced criticism for allegedly courting evangelical voters ahead of the October state governor election.

title: Investigators focus on sparklers on top of champagne bottles for deadly Swiss bar fire
summary: The bar owner insisted that all safety standards were followed. Authorities warned it could take days to identify everyone who perished.

title: Iran crackdown intensifies as Trump threatens to intervene
summary: At least eight protesters have been killed, 119 arrested and 33 injured since the protest movement began on December 28, 2025, according to human rights organizations. Security forces have stepped up operations in the provinces of Fars, Lorestan, Isfahan and Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari.

title: Kyrylo Budanov, master spy and Zelensky's new right hand
summary: A warrior at heart, the head of Ukrainian military intelligence has become, at 39, the president's chief of staff, at a diplomatically sensitive time for the country.

title: Machado celebrates Maduro ouster, but is scorned by Trump
summary: Maria Corina Machado backed the opposition's 2024 presidential candidate Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia to be president. But Donald Trump said the Nobel laureate doesn't have 'support or respect' in her country.

title: Questions linger two days after Swiss resort bar fire
summary: The investigation continues two days after a deadly fire broke out in a nightclub at the Swiss resort. The latest count puts the number of victims at 40 dead and 119 injured, most of them suffering severe burns.

title: Riyadh calls Yemen's southern factions to 'dialogue'
summary: Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates have for years supported various factions within Yemen's government-run territories, intervening in the neighboring country's long-running civil war.

title: Southern Yemen separatists push for secession
summary: The separatists of the Southern Transitional Council announced the adoption of a constitution paving the way for an independent state, a move that reignites military and political tensions in the country.

title: Trump says Maduro will be brought to New York to face charges
summary: In an interview with Fox News, President Donald Trump gave details about the operation on Saturday in which the US captured Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro.

title: Maduro now in New York jail as Trump says US to 'run' Venezuela
summary: The Venezuelan president and his wife were transported by helicopter to New York City, hours after US special forces seized them. The couple is to be arraigned on drug trafficking and weapons charges.

title: US captures Venezuelan leader Maduro, Trump says
summary: The US president said that the US military had launched a large-scale operation in Caracas and that President Nicolas Maduro and his wife had been flown out of the country. The US attorney general announced charges against them.

title: US military operation in Venezuela disrupts Caribbean holiday travel, hundreds of flights canceled
summary: No airline flights were crossing over Venezuela on Saturday, while major airlines canceled hundreds of flights across the eastern Caribbean region. Normal operations are to resume on Sunday.

title: US-Venezuela timeline: From sanctions to military action
summary: Relations between the two countries have been poor since the presidency of Hugo Chavez began in 2006. They continued to deteriorate under Nicolas Maduro, whom the US said it captured on Saturday.

title: World reactions to US operation in Venezuela
summary: US President Donald Trump said the US had carried out a 'large-scale strike' in Venezuela, capturing and exfiltrating President Nicolas Maduro.

title: Zelensky proposes transferring Ukraine's defense minister to energy
summary: The Ukrainian president proposed moving Defense Minister Denys Shmyhal to the energy portfolio, the latest cabinet change since a corruption scandal forced Volodymyr Zelensky's top aide to resign last month.

title: Berlin power outage hits 45,000 homes, police suspect far-left group
summary: Police were investigating an online claim of responsibility from a left-wing extremist group after an arson attack damaged power cables on Saturday morning.

title: Denmark irritated after Trump aide's wife posts pic of US-flagged Greenland
summary: Katie Miller, the wife of Donald Trump's deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller, posted an image showing Greenland in the colors of the US flag, with the caption 'SOON.'

title: Equatorial Guinea relocates capital to Ciudad de la Paz
summary: A decree from President Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo changed the capital from Malabo, which is on an island, to Ciudad de la Paz, located on the mainland.

title: For Putin, US operation in Venezuela is a double-edged sword
summary: The capture of President Nicolas Maduro by the US weakens Ukraine's allies, who have positioned themselves as defenders of democracy and international law. It also deals a blow to Moscow, depriving it of a key partner and threatening its oil revenues.

title: Myanmar junta frees 6,000 prisoners in annual amnesty
summary: Thousands of activists arrested since the military took power in a coup that triggered civil war in 2021.

title: Rubio says US will work with Venezuela's leaders if they 'make the right decision'
summary: The US secretary of state said Washington is ready to try working with Venezuela's vice president and now acting president, Delcy Rodriguez, after the abduction of Nicolas Maduro.

title: Swiss authorities identify 24 bodies of Crans-Montana bar fire
summary: Forty people were killed in the fire on New Year's Eve and 119 injured. The fatalities identified to date include 11 minors.

title: The kingdom of the 'shamassa,' Sudan's children of war
summary: 'War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation' (4/6) 'Shamassa' means 'child of the sun,' but these street children wear the name poorly. Turned into easy prey by the conflict, the orphans live at the mercy of armed groups, telling the story of war through a child's eyes.

title: UK and France strike IS site in Syria
summary: The British defense ministry said warplanes had targeted an underground facility where members of the Islamic State group are suspected to have stored weapons.

title: US intervention in Venezuela leaves collateral victim: Congress
summary: In the United States, the House of Representatives and the Senate are supposed to give their approval in cases of foreign conflict. They were neither consulted nor even informed ahead of the operation carried out on Saturday to seize Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

title: US intervention in Venezuela marks new blow to dying international order
summary: Venezuela's allies condemned an 'illegal act of aggression' while countries aligned with the US urged restraint but sought to avoid directly criticizing Donald Trump.

title: Venezuela's military recognizes Maduro's VP as acting president
summary: Defense Minister Vladimir Padrino Lopez backed Delcy Rodriguez, after a Supreme Court ruling that appointed her as acting president for 90 days following Nicolas Maduro's abduction by the US.

title: With Maduro abduction, Trump flexes muscles and sends world a message
summary: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro was abducted by US special forces. He is to stand trial before a federal court in New York on charges of 'narcoterrorism conspiracy.' Donald Trump has announced that the US plans to 'run' Venezuela up until a 'proper transition' and to exploit its oil reserves.

title: Cuba says 32 Cuban officers were killed in US action in Venezuela
summary: Cuba, a close ally of Venezuela's government, has announced two days of mourning for the officers who were killed.

title: Denmark warns US against taking Greenland by force
summary: PM Jens-Frederik Nielsen said that 'everything would stop' if the US were to employ military force against another NATO country, and 'that includes NATO and, therefore, post-World War II security.'

title: EU 'looking' into Grok's AI for sexually explicit childlike image generation
summary: European Commission spokesperson Thomas Regnier said that social media platform X had already responded to a request for information.

title: France backs Greenland after fresh Trump threats
summary: 'Borders cannot be changed by force,' a French Foreign Ministry spokesman said after  President Donald Trump renewed his claim that Greenland should become part of the US.

title: Holocaust survivor Eva Schloss, stepsister of Anne Frank, dies at 96
summary: Eva Schloss, the stepsister of diarist Anne Frank and a survivor of the Auschwitz concentration camp who dedicated decades to educating on the Holocaust, has died at age 96, her foundation announced on Sunday.

title: Venezuela's Maduro pleads not guilty in court, says he's still president
summary: Thousands marched through Caracas to support Maduro as his former deputy, Delcy Rodriguez, was sworn in as interim president on Monday. Donald Trump has said he wants to work with Rodriguez and the rest of Maduro's former team, provided that they submit to US demands for oil.

title: In reeling Venezuela, Delcy Rodriguez takes helm, under close scrutiny
summary: Following the US intervention and Nicolas Maduro's abduction, Vice President Delcy Rodriguez was designated as interim president by the Supreme Court and recognized by the military.

title: In Switzerland, grief and anger simmer, four days after deadly bar fire
summary: Thousands marched in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana on Sunday to honor the 40 people killed on New Year's Eve.

title: Iran says no leniency for 'rioters' as protests persist
summary: The remarks came after Donald Trump warned Iran would 'get hit very hard' by the US if the authorities killed more demonstrators. UN leader Antonio Guterres called on Iran to respect the demonstrators' right to peaceful protest, underscoring 'the need to prevent further casualties.'

title: Maduro's fate lies with US courts, as Venezuela's lies with Trump
summary: As the ousted Venezuelan president and his wife are set to face drug trafficking charges before a federal court in New York on Monday, the Trump administration declared its intention to secure control over their country's vast oil resources.

title: North Korea tests hypersonic missiles, says nuclear forces ready for war
summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said the firing of 'cutting-edge' hypersonic missiles was urgent in light of the 'recent geopolitical crisis,' in an apparent reference to the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by US special forces.

title: Phil Gunson: If Trump does not force Venezuela to hold free elections, 'they can agree on almost everything'
summary: The Caracas-based International Crisis Group analyst Phil Gunson underlines in an interview that Donald Trump has had 'harsh words' for opposition figure Maria Corina Machado and sees the possibility of an agreement between the US administration and the Venezuelan regime's remaining leaders.

title: Tim Walz drops bid for Minnesota governor reelection
summary: The US Democrats' 2024 candidate for vice president said he 'can't give a political campaign my all' after what Walz described as an 'extraordinarily difficult year for our state.'

title: Trump eyes new targets after toppling Maduro
summary: Colombia is one of the US president's latest targets. Donald Trump warned President Gustavo Petro, whom he has accused of drug trafficking, to 'watch his ass' and said military action 'sounds good to me.'

title: Trump insists US 'in charge' of Venezuela
summary: On Sunday, President Trump faced persistent questions about the seizure of President Maduro and his wife, and whether the operation's focus was about oil or regime change: 'It's about peace on Earth.' The deposed Maduro is due in a New York court on Monday.

title: 'Trump is torn between the UAE and Saudi Arabia'
summary: US President Donald Trump faces pressure from Mohammed bin Salman to oppose the separatist strategy pursued by the United Arab Emirates in Sudan, and even more so in Yemen, writes columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu, a professor at Sciences Po Paris.

title: US attack on Venezuela: What does international law say?
summary: According to international law, 'fighting drug trafficking and protecting democracy do not constitute legal grounds for the use of force.'

title: US operation in Venezuela: Trump's 'America First' now runs through Caracas
summary: The strikes against drug trafficking vessels concealed a broader offensive: Oil and Russian and Chinese influence in Caracas took precedence over the actual flows of fentanyl or cocaine, which were negligible from Venezuela.

title: Venezuelan parliament swears in interim president after Maduro's ouster
summary: As new acting president Delcy Rodriguez was sworn in, her brother, Jorge Rodriguez, was also elected speaker of parliament, leaving the influential siblings in control of Venezuela's executive and legislative branches.

title: After Venezuela, Greenland fears US annexation
summary: Following the US military intervention in Venezuela, Greenlanders, Danes and Europeans fear that the White House's next target may be the autonomous Danish territory that Donald Trump has coveted since his first term.

title: By targeting Venezuela, Donald Trump is also striking at China's interests
summary: China, which was purchasing mostly Venezuelan oil, has limited itself to statements criticizing the US intervention in Venezuela. However, the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, in violation of international law, has offered China a blank check to launch an attack on Taiwan.

title: Deep freeze grips Europe, killing six and disrupting travel
summary: On Tuesday, a brutal cold snap brought deadly accidents and widespread transport chaos across Europe, grounding flights, halting trains and leaving France hardest hit.

title: EU offers extra funds to quell farmer anger over Mercosur trade deal
summary: The European Union's executive arm proposed Tuesday to give farmers early access to some €45 billion as it looks to diffuse anger over a vast trade deal with South American bloc Mercosur, which Brussels hopes to sign next week.

title: European leaders pledge support for Denmark after Trump's Greenland threats
summary: Leaders of seven European powers voiced support for Danish sovereignty on Tuesday in response to Donald Trump's remarks coveting the territory of Greenland, which followed the US abduction of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro.

title: Greenland is and must remain European
summary: Following the abduction of Nicolas Maduro in Venezuela, the Danish autonomous territory has found itself once again on Donald Trump's list of targets. Such a threat risks dealing a fatal blow to NATO. For Europeans, it is high time to respond with firmness, the only language the US president understands.

title: Maduro, a 'prisoner of war,' proclaims his 'innocence' before New York court
summary: The arraignment hearing for drug trafficking charges leveled against Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, who was abducted by American forces in Caracas on Saturday, took place in Manhattan on Monday.

title: Swiss officials admit inspections failure at bar where deadly fire occurred
summary: 'Periodic inspections were not conducted between 2020 and 2025. We bitterly regret this,' Crans-Montana mayor Nicolas Feraud told a press conference in the Alpine ski resort, five days after the disaster at Le Constellation bar.

title: Swiss safety officials admit shortcomings after bar fire, French owners express regret
summary: Safety inspections at a bar struck by a deadly fire on New Year's Eve had not been carried out for the past five years, Swiss officials admitted Tuesday. The bar's French owners, who face charges for negligence and manslauger, said in their first public statements since the tragedy that they were 'devastated' and 'overwhelmed with grief.'

title: Thailand accuses Cambodia of breaking cease-fire, Cambodia claims an accident
summary: Phnom Penh called the incident 'an operational error,' while Bangkok stated that one of its soldiers was injured. A December 27 ceasefire had brought an end to three weeks of deadly fighting between the two countries, who have long disputed the demarcation of their shared border.

title: Trump weighs 'range of options' for acquiring Greenland, including military ones
summary: Donald Trump is looking at ideas for acquiring the Danish territory and using the US military is 'always an option,' the White House said on Tuesday. Earlier, Greenland and Denmark called for a meeting with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio after Trump's renewed claims.

title: Ukraine's Western allies agree on key security guarantees in Paris
summary: The security guarantees include a US-led monitoring mechanism and a European multinational force that would be deployed after a ceasefire in Russia's war against its neighbor.

title: US and European allies meet in Paris on Ukraine ceasefire guarantees
summary: On Tuesday, US envoys and key European allies gathered in Paris to discuss security guarantees for Ukraine, as Washington signaled it could lead ceasefire monitoring if a peace deal with Russia is reached.

title: US House Speaker Johnson backs elections in Venezuela
summary: Mike Johnson, the top member of Trump's Republican Party in Congress, said the elections 'should happen' and 'will need to' happen 'so that their economy can remain stabilized and the country can remain stabilized.'

title: US operation in Venezuela undermined international law, UN says
summary: 'States must not threaten or use force against the territorial integrity or political independence of any state,' Ravina Shamdasani, spokeswoman for the UN rights office, told reporters in Geneva on Tuesday.

title: Venezuela: From Orban to Farage, Europe's far right is unsettled by Trump's new imperialism
summary: The US operation in Venezuela has forced European nationalists to confront their own contradictions as politicians from countries that carry little weight compared to Russia, China and the United States.

title: With the Venezuela operation, Marco Rubio is at the heart of reshaping the 'Western Hemisphere'
summary: The secretary of state has fully embraced the MAGA movement and President Trump's ambitions. The Spanish-speaking Rubio is the chief architect of the US intervention and the main point of contact for Venezuela's new authorities.

title: After the Crans-Montana tragedy, residents express 'anger' and 'shame'
summary: The president of the Swiss town acknowledged during a press conference on Tuesday morning that Crans-Montana's municipal services had not conducted any safety inspections at Le Constellation bar since 2019, sparking outrage.

title: Europe yet to give 'clear, unequivocal answer' on Ukraine defense, Zelensky says
summary: European leaders and US envoys agreed on 'key security guarantees for Kyiv,' as talks continued in Paris.

title: France bans food imports containing certain pesticides
summary: The five substances targeted include fungicides, used on produce ranging from avocados to soybeans, and glufosinate, an herbicide widely used on potatoes. The move is aimed at easing farmers' opposition to the Mercosur trade deal.

title: Gaza's grandparents, shattered pillars of a traumatized society
summary: Elderly people, whose health is often fragile and mobility reduced, feel as if they are reliving the tragedy of the Nakba, the forced exodus of Palestinians during the creation of Israel in 1948.

title: Greenland: Europe rejects US threats over sovereignty but finds options limited
summary: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said on Tuesday that Donald Trump was considering 'several options,' including the use of the military, to acquire the Arctic island. Even though, under existing agreements, nothing prevents the US from increasing its military presence there.

title: In Paris, Ukraine's allies express hopes and fears over US security guarantees
summary: The coalition of the willing, a group of Kyiv's allies who met in Paris on Tuesday, said they were ready to send troops to Ukraine for a ceasefire if they were guaranteed that the US would deter any new Russian attack.

title: Trump's unchecked imperialism raises growing concerns
summary: While the Trump administration's handling of the Venezuelan situation has revealed numerous contradictions, its intentions regarding Greenland have sparked anxiety and opposition among members of Congress, including Republicans.

title: Iran's regime faces combined pressure from street protests, Israel and US
summary: Israel has approved a new attack plan against Tehran, while Donald Trump has reiterated his threats to intervene should Iran intensify its crackdown on a protest movement against inflation and the Islamic regime.

title: Saudi-led coalition strikes Yemen as separatist leader flees
summary: Aidarous al-Zubaidi, who heads the Southern Transitional Council, which seeks to reestablish a state in southern Yemen, fled after being accused of 'high treason' for attempting to secede.

title: Trump plots offer to buy Greenland as NATO ally Denmark seethes
summary: The US president has spoken with his national security team about making an offer to purchase Greenland from Denmark, the White House said Wednesday, despite Copenhagen making clear the Arctic island was not for sale. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said he would meet Danish officials to discuss the issue next week.

title: Trump says Venezuela is 'turning over' up to 50 million barrels of oil to US
summary: The US president, in a post on Truth Social on Tuesday, said 'that money will be controlled by me' and that he will 'ensure it is used to benefit the people of Venezuela and the United States.'

title: US immigration officer kills woman in Minneapolis
summary: An officer shot and killed a woman whom US officials accused of trying to run over ICE agents with her vehicle. The city's mayor has called that claim 'bullshit' and demanded that federal immigration agents leave the city.

title: US seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker in the Atlantic
summary: The operation ratcheted up tensions with Moscow as the US flexes its military might in the Caribbean.

title: US will control Venezuelan oil sales 'indefinitely,' energy secretary says
summary: United States Energy Secretary Chris Wright said Wednesday the US would control Venezuela's oil sales until further notice, four days after the Latin American country's leader Nicolas Maduro was abducted in a US military intervention.

title: In pictures Kidnapping of Nicolas Maduro: Five months of military deployments pave the way for US intervention in Venezuela
summary: Images verified by Le Monde made it possible to reconstruct the US's vast military deployment at sea, on land and in the air in the months leading up to the abduction of the Venezuelan president.

title: Venezuela: Iran risks losing a key economic and military ally
summary: Tehran and Caracas have maintained close ties with each other, notably to circumvent the sanctions against both countries. Iran, which has also come under threat from Washington, has projected a facade of optimism.

title: Venezuela: US no longer accuses Maduro of leading the Cartel de los Soles
summary: The indictment against the former Venezuelan president, presented by US authorities on Monday, no longer includes the accusation from five years ago, which had until recently been claimed by the Trump administration.

title: After threatening the Colombian president with military action, Trump invites Gustavo Petro to the White House
summary: The US president threatened his counterpart over alleged drug trafficking after US forces ousted Nicolas Maduro. On Wednesday, he had a phone call with the Colombian president and said he was arranging for a meeting 'in the near future.'

title: China's Pingtan Island reflects rising tensions in the Taiwan Strait
summary: On Pingtan Island, China's closest point to Taiwan, repeated Chinese military maneuvers are exasperating fishers and fueling 'reunification' tourism.

title: France seeks to assert role in Caribbean after Trump's show of force
summary: The Sénat's foreign affairs, defense and armed forces committee has voiced concern over the impact of US policy in the Guiana Shield, which includes Guyana, Suriname and French Guiana.

title: France will vote against EU-Mercosur trade deal, Macron says
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron said Thursday that France would vote against the European Union's trade deal with South American bloc Mercosur. The deal, which EU member states will vote on Friday, has sparked protests among French farmers, who fear the consequences of competition from Brazil and its neighbors.

title: French judges alarmed by rumors of US sanctioning magistrates who sentenced Le Pen
summary: Peimane Ghaleh-Marzban, the president of the Paris judicial court, spoke out to condemn what he called 'unacceptable interference.' His remarks followed revelations in the German press about the possibility that the United States might sanction the French judges who sentenced Marine Le Pen.

title: French researcher freed from Russian jail arrives home after prisoner swap
summary: Emmanuel Macron said researcher Laurent Vinatier had arrived in France on Thursday from Russia, where he faced spying accusations. Vinatier was released in exchange for Russian basketball player Daniil Kasatkin, whom US authorities accuse of ransomware hacking.

title: 'If Doctors Without Borders were to cease activities in Gaza, the impact would be absolutely enormous'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Filipe Ribeiro, head of mission for Doctors Without Borders in Jerusalem, responds to the Israeli government's decision to ban it and 36 other non-governmental organizations from operating in the occupied Palestinian territories.

title: In Gaza, the war is creating a new generation of deaf children
summary: According to a survey by a local non-profit organization, 35,000 children and adults have partially or completely lost their hearing during the two years of war that followed the Hamas attack in October 2023.

title: Israeli government accelerates settlement expansion in occupied West Bank
summary: With tenders for 9,600 housing units for Jewish families in the occupied West Bank, 2025 set a record, with an openly stated goal of delivering 'a fatal blow to the idea of a Palestinian state.'

title: Macron says US is 'turning away' from allies
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron warned of shifting US priorities in an annual address to ambassadors at the Elysée Palace in Paris, days after the US capture of Nicolas Maduro in Caracas.

title: Trump withdraws United States from UN climate treaty
summary: The White House announced the US would withdraw from a total of 66 international organizations, saying they were 'contrary to the interests of the United States.'

title: Protesters clash with police in Minneapolis after ICE officer kills woman
summary: Angry demonstrators clashes with US law enforcement officials in Minneapolis on Thursday, the day after the fatal shooting of a woman by an agent of the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agency.

title: Syria: New clashes between government forces and Kurds signal failure of negotiations
summary: The latest outbreak of violence highlights the deadlock in talks over the integration of the Kurdish-majority Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) into the new Syrian state.

title: Take Trump seriously on Greenland, Vance warns Europe
summary: The US vice president advised European leaders to take the 'security' of Greenland more seriously, or else the US would 'have to do something about it.'

title: 'They tried to erase our history': Sudan's national heritage is threatened by war
summary: 'War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation' (5/6)  When the country's museum collections fell into the Rapid Support Forces' hands, they became a real weapon in the conflict with the regular army. Some say the aim is to erase and replace Sudanese identity.

title: Trump-Colombia tensions thaw after months of heated exchanges
summary: After threatening and insulting Colombian leader Gustavo Petro, the US president unexpectedly invited him to the White House.

title: UN says the US has 'legal obligation' to fund agencies after Trump withdraws from several
summary: Top United Nations officials urged the United States to keep paying its dues that fund UN agencies, many of which focus on climate, labor and migration – issues Trump's administration have categorized as 'woke' initiatives.

title: US strengthens grip on Venezuela by seizing two oil tankers, including one flying the Russian flag
summary: The US Coast Guard pursued the ship, which had placed itself under Russian protection, as far as the waters off Iceland. Washington said it belonged to the 'ghost fleet' transporting oil under sanctions.

title: US will control Venezuela and its oil sales indefinitely, Trump says
summary: The Trump administration said Washington will dictate decisions in Caracas and oversee Venezuela's oil exports after the US seizure of president Nicolas Maduro.

title: Venezuela begins large-scale prisoner release, including ex-presidential candidate
summary: The move is widely seen as a concession to the United States following the ouster of Nicolas Maduro and Washington's push to secure access to the country's vast oil reserves.

title: AFCON 2025: Recalled Ndiaye takes Senegal past 10-man Mali into semifinals
summary: Senegal overcame the Malian team 1-0 on Friday, in the quarterfinals of the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations, in Tangier, Morocco. As the first team to qualify for the final four, Senegal will face either Egypt or Côte d'Ivoire.

title: Belgian multimillionaire aims to build a 'Caribbean Dubai' in the Antilles
summary: The government of Saint Kitts and Nevis is poised to approve the creation of an autonomous enclave designed to attract thousands of wealthy investors to the island of Nevis. Many residents oppose the emergence of what they call a 'state within a state.'

title: French researcher held in Russia freed in prisoner swap
summary: After 19 months in detention in Moscow, Laurent Vinatier was transferred to Paris on Thursday. He was exchanged for a Russian basketball player and hacker, who had been detained in France.

title: Iran cuts internet as protest movement against regime grows
summary: Iranians took to the streets on the evening of Thursday, following a call from Reza Pahlavi, the exiled son of Iran's last shah, and from Kurdish political parties. Turnout was massive in major cities.

title: Iran protests swell nationwide as crackdown intensifies and internet is cut
summary: The country saw the largest demonstrations in nearly two weeks, with rights groups reporting dozens of protesters killed.

title: New protests erupt in Iran despite internet shutdown
summary: Speaking before his supporters, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said the protesters were 'vandals' seeking to 'please the US president.'  Trump said it looked like the Iranian leaders were 'in big trouble' and reiterated his warning that he could order military strikes

title: Killing of Renee Good in Minneapolis reignites US debate over ICE
summary: The 37-year-old mother was shot dead by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement agent while maneuvering her vehicle on a street on Wednesday. Footage of the incident, which does not confirm the self-defense claim put forward by the Trump administration, has sparked outrage across the United States.

title: Northern Sudan watches the war from afar
summary: War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation (6/6). The northern region of Sudan, spared so far from the fighting between the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces and the regular army, has taken in thousands of displaced people. But as the conflict drags on and draws closer, local militias are organizing.

title: Pope Leo says 'war is back in vogue'
summary: In his first New Year's message to diplomats at the Vatican, Pope Leo XIV spoke of the 'weakness of multilateralism,' serious threats to 'the rule of law' and lamented rising violence in the occupied West Bank.

title: Russia strikes Ukraine with hypersonic missile amid temporary evacuation of Kyiv
summary: The strikes came in response to a December attack on the residence of Russian leader Vladimir Putin, which Russia blamed on Ukraine. On Friday, a drone strike in Kyiv killed four people and wounded at least 24 others.

title: Somalia denies seizing US-funded food aid as Washington suspends assistance
summary: The country's authorities have been accused of destroying a World Food Programme warehouse and seizing American-funded food aid.

title: Swiss prosecutors request pre-trial detention for bar manager over fatal New Year's Eve fire
summary: According to an initial investigation, the fire that led to 40 deaths was caused by sparkling candles, which ignited the bar's basement ceiling. Prosecutors deemed one of the bar's managers to be at 'risk of flight.'

title: Syrian authorities declare ceasefire in Aleppo after deadly clashes
summary: The violence in the region was the worst in a year after days of fighting between government forces and Kurdish fighters killed at least 21 people and displaced thousands.

title: Trump says US is 'going to do something on Greenland, whether they like it or not'
summary: Denmark and other European allies have voiced shock at Donald Trump's threats to take control of Greenland, where the United States already has a military base. Trump says controlling the mineral-rich island is crucial for US national security given the rising military activity of Russia and China in the Arctic.

title: Venezuelan prisoners are released but doubts remain over democratic opening
summary: The head of Venezuela's parliament announced that a 'significant number' of prisoners, including foreign nationals, would be released. Many advocacy groups saw the move as a 'positive signal' but hoped it would not be just a one-off gesture.

title: Anger over Minneapolis shooting probe fuels protests
summary: Renee Good was one of four people who have been killed by ICE since Trump launched his immigration crackdown. The Trump administration has sought to paint the victim as a 'domestic terrorist,' insisting that the Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent who fatally shot her was acting in self-defense.

title: Frenchman fined for cracking egg on far-right leader Bardella's head
summary: At Jordan Bardella's November book launch in the southern town of Moissac, a retired farmer stood in line and broke an egg on Bardella's head when he reached him. The same man was also sentenced in 2022 after throwing an egg at another far-right candidate, Eric Zemmour, during the presidential elections.

title: Greenland's parties reject American rule after latest Trump threat
summary: 'We don't want to be Americans,' the leaders of five parties in Greenland's parliament said in a joint statement, after Donald Trump once again threatened to 'do something on Greenland, whether they like it or not.'

title: Iran's bloody and concealed crackdown
summary: Iran's regime, which has cut off internet access across the country, has now labeled protesters as 'terrorist agents' and claimed they were paid by Israel and the United States.

title: Laurent Vinatier's release: Putin makes a gesture amid frozen France-Russia relations
summary: The Kremlin's decision to free French researcher Laurent Vinatier could mark the beginning of renewed dialogue between Emmanuel Macron and Vladimir Putin, following a first, unsuccessful attempt in July 2025.

title: Metric or imperial? Canada faces the everyday puzzle of weights and measures
